title: REMOTE Property Manager (UK Property Management Experience | UK Hours)
description:
This job post is for Filipino Virtual Assistants based in the Philippines, and with at least 2 years of remote experience as a UK Property Manager.



How to Apply:

* To apply, please submit the required information and documents via this form  ---  

* Please note: We use the Hubstaff app to track work hours and meal breaks, manage timesheets, and support payroll processing. To ensure accurate time tracking and full focus during scheduled shifts, we ask that VAs work exclusively for our company during their assigned hours. We value integrity and professionalism and aim to work with VAs who uphold these standards at all times.



About PropPerly Co. UK:

* PropPerly is a UK-managed Virtual Assistant agency that connects talented Filipino professionals with UK and international clients. We focus on long-term, stable placements — not short gigs. We’re now hiring a Property Virtual Assistant with proven experience in property management, ideally within the UK market. You’ll be supporting our UK clients — including letting agencies, landlords, and property managers — with daily administrative, tenancy, and maintenance coordination tasks.



What You’ll Do:

* Manage tenancy documentation, renewals, and compliance records

* Coordinate maintenance requests with tenants, contractors, and landlords

* Update property listings, respond to tenant inquiries, and manage calendars

* Handle admin and bookkeeping tasks, including rent tracking and reconciliation

* Maintain accurate records and communicate updates to clients efficiently

* Assist with HMO management, single lets, or Airbnb operations (where applicable)



What We’re Looking For:

* 2+ years experience in property management (UK experience is a major plus)

* Strong English communication skills (written and spoken)

* Creative, Detail-oriented, Professional, and Proactive

* Reliable equipment, quiet workspace, and internet speed of at least 10 Mbps

* Full-time commitment — not working with multiple clients



Tools You Might Use:

* Google Workspace / Microsoft Office

* Property management CRMs (Arthur, GoTenant, OpenRent, etc.)

* Bookkeeping platforms (Xero, QuickBooks)



Why Join PropPerly:

* between $5 and $6 per hour, depending on experience and interview performance, paid in USD via Wise

* Rate increase possible after 3–6 months of consistent performance

* Long-term stability with one dedicated client

* Clear systems, UK-based support, and monthly payments

* Professional, growth-oriented remote team



Schedule:

* UK Business Hours (4 PM–12 AM PH Time)

* Full-Time or Part-Time (Long-Term Placement)
salary: between USD 5 and USD 6 per hour

title: Revyoos Sales Representative (Lead Closer / Outbound Specialist)
description:
Revyoos is hiring a results-driven Sales Representative (Lead Closer / Outbound Specialist) to help us scale fast in the vacation rental and hospitality SaaS market.



This role is built for someone who lives and breathes outbound B2B sales, executes structured multi-channel prospecting sequences, and consistently converts qualified conversations into recurring revenue (MRR).



You will own deals end-to-end, work with clear targets and KPIs, and be a key driver of Revyoos’ next growth phase as we expand internationally.



You will proactively engage vacation rental property managers and small hotel operators, guide them through the consultative sales process, and convert qualified leads into long-term Revyoos customers.



Experience in the vacation rental, short-term rental, property management software (PMS), or hospitality tech space is a strong plus.



---



## Key Responsibilities



### Outbound B2B Sales



Own the outbound motion end-to-end by engaging warm and cold leads via phone,
, LinkedIn, and automated prospecting sequences.



### Lead Management & Follow-Up



Execute disciplined, multi-touch follow-ups to maximize response and meeting rates and ensure no opportunity is missed.



### CRM & Sales Sequences



Use Zoho CRM to manage pipelines, build and optimize sequences, automate follow-ups, and maintain accurate sales data and forecasting.



### Consultative Selling



Understand the challenges vacation rental operators face around reviews, online reputation, direct bookings, and conversion rate. Clearly communicate Revyoos’ value and tailor each conversation to prospect needs.



### Closing & Objection Handling



Handle objections confidently, negotiate pricing, and convert free trials into paying SaaS customers.



### Collaboration & Optimization



Work closely with marketing and leadership to refine ICP targeting, messaging, and outbound performance.



### Sales Metrics



Track pipeline, conversion rates, and MRR generation inside Zoho CRM and continuously optimize outreach strategies.



---



## Requirements



• Proven experience in outbound B2B SaaS sales, lead conversion, and closing

• Strong expertise in outbound prospecting, sequences, and follow-up systems

• Hands-on experience with Zoho CRM or similar CRM platforms

• Ability to manage high-volume outreach independently

• Fluent, professional English (spoken and written)

• Availability overlapping Europe and US Eastern Time

• Excellent communication, persuasion, and negotiation skills

• Highly self-motivated and target-oriented

title: Virtualization Specialist
description:
We are looking for a Virtualization Specialist who can design, deploy, and operate KVM-based environments—especially Proxmox VE and Linux virtualization stacks. You will support customer implementations, troubleshoot production issues, and help improve our virtualization architecture and operational standards.



Key Responsibilities

 • Design and implement KVM-based virtualization environments (with emphasis on Proxmox VE)

 • Configure and maintain virtualization hosts, clusters, and core services (compute, storage, networking)

 • Perform troubleshooting and root-cause analysis for performance, availability, and configuration issues

 • Support migration projects (physical-to-virtual, hypervisor-to-hypervisor, and workload moves)

 • Optimize virtualization performance and reliability (CPU/memory tuning, I/O, network throughput)

 • Define and maintain best practices: documentation, runbooks, backups, and recovery procedures

 • Collaborate with internal teams and customers on planning, delivery, and ongoing operations



Required Qualifications

 • Strong hands-on experience with KVM virtualization on Linux

 • Practical experience with Proxmox VE (setup, cluster, storage, networking, backups)

 • Solid Linux administration skills (systemd, networking, storage, logs, troubleshooting)

 • Experience with virtualization networking concepts (bridging, VLANs, bonding, routing/firewall basics)

 • Familiarity with storage options commonly used in KVM/Proxmox (e.g., ZFS, LVM, NFS, iSCSI, Ceph—any subset)

title: WANTED! The World's Most Detail-Oriented Remote Bookkeeping VA
description:
WANTED! The World's Most Detail-Oriented Remote Bookkeeping VA



When you apply, please make sure the subject line is: "I actually read the instructions"



Who We Are



We're Real Cents Organized, a growing bookkeeping firm that specializes in helping real estate investors and landlords build wealth through accurate, timely financials. Our clients aren't just property owners—they're building generational wealth, and they depend on us to give them the clarity they need to make smart decisions.



We're a small, tight-knit remote team (currently just two of us!) that values accuracy over speed, proactive communication, and continuous learning. We don't micromanage—we hire self-directed professionals who take ownership of their work and treat our clients' businesses like their own.



We're at an exciting inflection point: we have more clients than we can handle (great problem!), and we need a second VA to help us scale without sacrificing the quality our clients love.



Quick note: When you
 your application, please start your message with "I'm excited to apply for the bookkeeping position at Real Cents Organized" so we know your
 didn't get caught in our spam filter. We've had issues with legitimate applications landing in junk folders lately!



What We're Looking For



We need a detail-obsessed bookkeeping VA who lives and breathes QuickBooks Online, understands the unique challenges of real estate accounting, and can work independently to deliver accurate financials on tight deadlines.



This isn't data entry—this is strategic bookkeeping. You'll be the person who catches the $5,000 repair that should have been capitalized before it costs our client their tax deduction. You'll be the one who spots a missing security deposit refund before the landlord gets a call from an angry tenant.



If you're the type of person who color-codes their personal budget, triple-checks your work, and feels genuine satisfaction when a reconciliation balances to the penny—keep reading.



Job Description



Key Responsibilities



You'll be responsible for these specific deliverables each month:



1. Transaction Categorization: Accurately categorize monthly transactions across multiple rental properties in QuickBooks Online. You'll distinguish between repairs vs. capital improvements, allocate expenses to the correct properties, and ensure every transaction supports defensible tax positions.



2. Bank Reconciliations: Reconcile bank accounts monthly with 100?curacy. Find every discrepancy—even the $0.23 rounding errors—because precision matters.



3. Property-Level Financial Reporting: Generate clean, client-ready profit & loss statements for each rental property, plus consolidated owner statements, by the 5th of each month. No excuses, no delays—landlords make decisions based on these reports.



4. Compliance Tracking: Maintain meticulous records for security deposits, track vendor payments for 1099 preparation, and flag any transactions that could trigger IRS scrutiny.



5. Proactive Communication: Use ClickUp to update task status daily, flag discrepancies before they become problems, and ask clarifying questions when something doesn't add up. We'd rather you ask 10 "unnecessary" questions than make 1 incorrect assumption.



Qualifications



We care more about **how you think** than where you went to school. Here's what matters:



- QuickBooks Online fluency - You don't just know where the buttons are; you understand chart of accounts structure, class/location tracking, and can troubleshoot when things break.



- Real estate accounting experience - You've worked with rental properties before and understand the difference between a repair (expense immediately) and an improvement (capitalize and depreciate). Bonus if you've handled short-term rentals.



- Obsessive attention to detail - You're the person who notices when a transaction is coded to "Property A - Unit 1" when it should be "Property A - Unit 2." Small mistakes compound into big problems in this work.



- Strong written English - You'll communicate directly with ClickUp comments and occasional
s. We need clear, professional communication that builds trust.



- Self-directed work style - We're async and remote. You won't have someone looking over your shoulder. You need to manage your own time, prioritize ruthlessly, and deliver on deadlines without hand-holding.



- Technology comfort - Beyond QBO, you'll use ClickUp (project management and communication), Google Workspace, and ScreenshotMonitor (screen recordings).



Salary & Growth



Starting Compensation: $7/hour for 20-30 hours per week ($560-$840/month)



We know this is competitive for the Philippines market, and we're willing to pay for quality. After your 60-day trial period, here's the path forward:



- **Month 6+:** Increase to $8/hour + potential for full-time hours (40/week = $1,280/month)

- **Year 2:** Promotion to Senior Bookkeeper at $10/hour managing your own portfolio of clients

- **Year 3+:** Potential equity stake or profit-sharing as we scale (we want to build this together)



We don't just hire people—we invest in them. Our current VA has been with us for 18 months.  



Personality Profile



**You're probably a great fit if:**



- You get genuine satisfaction from balancing to the penny (and mild anxiety when things are off by $0.01)

- You're naturally skeptical—when something looks weird, you dig deeper instead of ignoring it

- You prefer written communication over phone calls (but can handle a video call when needed)

- You have a system for everything (folders, naming conventions, checklists—you're organized AF)

- You'd describe yourself as reliable, methodical, and low-drama

- You like working independently but aren't afraid to ask for help when you need it



**You're probably NOT a great fit if:**



- You're easily bored by repetitive tasks (bookkeeping has a rhythm—embrace it)

- You're a "big picture" thinker who hates details (we need detail ninjas)

- You need constant feedback and validation to stay motivated

- You struggle with deadlines or tend to procrastinate

- You're juggling 5 other clients and can only give us 5 hours/week of distracted attention



Skunks (Deal-Breakers)



Let's be honest about potential challenges upfront. These are non-negotiable, so please only apply if you're genuinely comfortable with:



1. Strict Deadlines: Month-end close is sacred. If reports are due by the 5th, "the 6th" isn't acceptable. Clients make financial decisions based on our timelines.



2. High Accountability: Every error has real consequences. A misclassified transaction could cost a client thousands in unnecessary taxes or trigger an IRS audit. We need someone who takes this seriously.



3. Occasional US Business Hours: Most work is async, but you may need to join tea
etings during US Eastern Time business hours (which means early morning if you're in the Philippines). This won't be daily, but maybe 2-4 times per month.



4. 60-Day Trial Period: We're investing heavily in finding the right person (hence this detailed job posting!). The first 60 days are a mutual evaluation. If it's not working for either of us, we'll part ways professionally—no hard feelings.



5. Real Estate Focus: If you're looking to do general bookkeeping across industries, this isn't the role. We specialize in rental properties, and you'll need to develop deep expertise in this niche.



Our Values



These aren't just words on a wall—we actually make decisions based on these:



1. Accuracy Over Speed

We'd rather you take an extra hour to get it right than rush and create cleanup work. Slow is smooth, smooth is fast.



2. Proactive Communication

Don't wait for us to ask. If you see a problem, flag it. If you're unsure, ask. If you'll miss a deadline, tell us ASAP so we can plan.



3. Continuous Learning

Tax laws change. QBO adds features. Real estate strategies evolve. We expect you to stay current through webinars, articles, and training (which we'll provide/fund).



4. Client-First Mindset

Our clients are building generational wealth for their families. Treat their money with the same respect you'd want someone to treat yours.



5. Trust & Ownership

We don't micromanage. We hire adults, give them the tools and context they need, and trust them to deliver. In exchange, you own your results—good and bad.



To Apply



Here's what we need from you (this is a test—follow the instructions exactly):



1.
 Subject Line

"I actually read the instructions"



If your subject line is anything else (like "Bookkeeping VA Application"), we'll know you didn't read this carefully—and attention to detail is literally the job.



2. Resume

- File name: `FirstName_LastName_BookkeepingVA.pdf`

- Example: `Maria_Santos_BookkeepingVA.pdf`

- Highlight your QuickBooks Online experience and any real estate/property management clients

- Keep it to 1-2 pages max—we value clarity over length



3. Personality Assessment

Take the free 16Personalities test at 
 and include your 4-letter result (e.g., ISTJ, ISFJ) in your
. We use this to understand work style, not to exclude anyone—there's no "right" answer.



4. Creative Question

Answer this in 2-3 sentences within your
:



"If you were a QuickBooks report, which one would you be and why?"



(Seriously. We want to see how you think about the work, not just your resume credentials.)



5. Video Introduction

Record a 60-second Loom video (
 is free) covering:

- Your name and where you're based

- Your QuickBooks Online experience (how many years? what industries?)

- One example of a costly error you caught before it became a problem

- Why you're interested in specializing in real estate bookkeeping



Include the Loom link in your
.



6. Sample Work (Optional, but Impressive)

If you have any property-level P&Ls, reconciliation screenshots, or examples of your QBO work (with client names redacted), include them. Show us what "excellent" looks like in your book.



What Happens Next?



Here's our hiring process (transparent, fast, and designed to avoid wasting your time):



Week 1: We'll review applications and respond within 3 business days. If your application follows instructions and looks strong, we'll invite you to a paid trial project.



Week 2: Trial project ($20 for ~2 hours of work). We'll give you access to a QuickBooks sandbox with realistic scenarios. This lets you see the actual work, and lets us evaluate your skills beyond a resume.



Week 3: Top 2-3 candidates from the trial project will have a 30-45 minute Zoom interview. We'll discuss the work, your trial project, and cultural fit.



Week 4: We'll make an offer, finalize the contractor agreement, and get you onboarded!



Total timeline from application to start date: 3-4 weeks max.



Why You Should Apply (Even If You're Nervous)



Look, we know imposter syndrome is real. You might be reading this thinking, "I don't check every single box—should I even apply?"



Here's our take: If you're detail-oriented, have solid QBO skills, and are willing to learn real estate accounting specifics, we want to hear from you. We'd rather teach someone the technical stuff (we can train) than try to teach attention to detail or work ethic (you either have that or you don't).



The fact that you read this entire job posting (it's long—congrats if you made it here!) suggests you're thorough. That's exactly what we need.



Ready to Apply?



Send your application to: 



Subject line: "I actually read the instructions"



Include:

1. Resume (FirstName_LastName_BookkeepingVA.pdf)

2. Personality type (from 
)

3. Answer to the QuickBooks report question

4. Loom video link (60 seconds)

5. Optional: Sample work



Application deadline: March 12, 2026 (applications reviewed on a rolling basis)



We're excited to find someone who nerds out about clean books as much as we do. If that's you, hit send—let's build something great together.



P.S. - If you're thinking "This job posting is way too long"... you're probably not detail-oriented enough for this role. If you're thinking "I love how thorough this is—it shows they actually care about finding the right fit"... we're going to get along great.????

title: Patent Legal Assistant
description:
A Legal Assistant (Patent) plays a crucial role in supporting the legal team, particularly in intellectual property (IP) matters, with a focus on patents and occasional involvement in trademark cases. This role involves assisting attorneys and patent agents in various aspects of patent and IP law, including research, documentation, and administrative tasks. The primary responsibilities of a Patent Paralegal include:



Key Responsibilities:

1. Patent Filings: Provide support to external legal counsel in the submission of patent applications in jurisdictions that mandate filings exclusively by attorneys. Prepare, review, and file patent applications with the appropriate patent or intellectual property offices whenever possible. Ensure compliance with filing requirements and deadlines.



2. Patent Prosecution Support: Assist in managing patent prosecution activities, such as tracking deadlines, preparing responses to office actions, and communicating with patent examiners and/or external counsel.



3. Patent Search and Analysis: Conduct patent searches to assist in the evaluation of patentability and patent infringement issues. Summarize and present findings to legal professionals and/or external counsel.



4. Document Management: Organize and maintain intellectual property related documents, including but not related to patent portfolios, external counsel correspondence, and related paperwork. Manage electronic and physical files efficiently.



5. Deadline Compliance: Maintain and update patent docketing systems to ensure accurate tracking of patent deadlines, including maintenance fees and annuities.

6. Communication: Prepare correspondence for external counsel and internal tea
mbers to provide updates, gather information, communicate instructions, and facilitate collaboration on patent and IP matters.



7. Trademark and Copyright Assistance: Provide support in various trademark-related tasks, including conducting trademark searches, preparing trademark applications, and managing trademark maintenance. Additionally, assist with copyright tasks, such as advising on copyright registration, submission of documents and requirements under copyright laws, and aiding in the enforcement of copyright protections.



8. Legal Research: Conduct legal research into matters pertaining to patent and intellectual property law, ensuring continual awareness and understanding of evolving regulatory frameworks, case law, and best practices.



9. Administrative Support: Handle administrative tasks, such as billing, scheduling, and preparing reports and other duties as required by the legal team.



Qualifications:

* A bachelor's degree in a related field is often preferred.

* Paralegal certification that allows them to prepare and/or prosecute patent applications.

* Experience in Patent and IP law.

* Proficiency in legal research, patent databases, and document management software.

* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with legal professionals and clients.

* Knowledge of patent prosecution procedures and USPTO rules and regulations.

* Familiarity with intellectual property law in multiple jurisdictions (a plus, but not always required).

title: Compliance and Documentation Coordinator
description:
Overview

The Compliance and Documentation Coordinator is responsible for organizing, maintaining, and standardizing the company’s digital documentation across all departments. This role ensures that files, records, and reference materials are properly structured, easily accessible, and consistently updated — supporting smooth collaboration and operational efficiency across the organization.



Key Responsibilities

 Develop and maintain a centralized digital filing system for all departments (e.g., HR, Finance, Operations, Marketing).

 Ensure consistency in file naming, structure, and version control across shared drives and platforms.

 Regularly audit folders and files to remove duplicates, outdated content, and ensure accuracy.

 Coordinate with department heads to collect, organize, and update key documents, SOPs, and reports.

 Support documentation of workflows, processes, and company templates for operational use.

 Manage access permissions and data organization within platforms such as Google Drive, Notion, or SharePoint.

 Maintain logs and summaries of documentation updates and communicate changes to relevant teams.

 Provide guidance to tea
mbers on proper file management practices and document handling.



Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or related field (preferred but not required).

 Proven experience in digital file management, documentation, or operations coordination.

 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

 Familiarity with cloud storage platforms (e.g., Google Workspace, SharePoint, Dropbox).

 Excellent communication and coordination skills.

 Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks in a digital, fast-paced environment.



Preferred Skills

 Experience creating or maintaining SOPs and documentation templates. 

 Knowledge of data privacy and file access protocols.

 Basic understanding of project management or workflow tools



Success Indicators

 Company files are well-organized, easily searchable, and consistently formatted.

 Documentation updates are completed on time and communicated clearly.

 Teams can locate and use resources efficiently with minimal duplication or confusion.

title: Operations & Marketing Assistant (Automotive)
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Employment: Full-time

Salary: $500/month

Time zone: Stockholm time



IMPORTANT: PLEASE ATTACH A COPY OF YOUR RESUME TO BE CONSIDERED.



Company Overview



Bilsmidigt is a fast-growing online used-car dealer in Sweden. We sell cars fully online, offer free home delivery, and focus on creating a smooth, transparent customer experience. We operate with strong processes, modern tools, and a remote first mindset. As we grow rapidly, we are building a detail driven operations team to support scale.



What You Will Mainly Do (Initial Scope)

-Create and update car listings including headlines, bullet points, and specifications for marketplaces and WordPress using SOPs and templates.

-Source, organize, and quality check images and videos. Ensure correct order and standards, coordinate with editors, and publish listings on time.

-Search for accurate information on the internet and across different databases related to vehicles, equipment, and specifications.



You Will Also Assist With

-As the company grows, future tasks may include creating and managing images and videos for social media or ads, maintaining lead sheet hygiene, drafting template
s, calendar coordination, vendor comparisons including price and lead time, and basic cost tracking.



Tools you will use:

-Airtable, ChatGPT, Excel / Google Sheets, Google Workspace (Docs/Drive), Slack, WordPress,

Canva or Photopea/Photoshop (basic). 

-Experience with cerating advertisments for internet is a plus,

but not a must, we’ll train.



Must Haves

-Excellent written and verbal English with crisp and error free communication.

-High attention to detail and strong process discipline with a natural ability to spot and handle mistakes properly.

-Strong PC skills with the ability to learn new tools quickly, reliable internet with backup, and the ability to find correct and detailed information efficiently.

Your Nice-to-Haves:

-Airtable/WordPress familiarity, light image editing.

-Basic analytics and/or Zapier/automation interest.

-Automotive Background



If you enjoy structured work, learning new tools, and taking ownership of outcomes in a fast paced environment, you will thrive at Bilsmidigt AB.

title: Financial Operations Analyst
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Employment: Full-time

Salary: $500/month

Time zone: Stockholm time



Company Overview



Bilsmidigt is a fast-growing online used-car dealer in Sweden. We sell cars fully online, offer free home delivery, and focus on creating a smooth, transparent customer experience.



Behind the scenes, our business has many moving parts—car sourcing, reconditioning, logistics, sales, and finance. This role is critical in making sure our numbers are accurate, our margins are protected, and small financial issues don’t turn into big losses.



Role Purpose



Your main goal is to reduce money leakage by catching small financial inconsistencies, improving control routines, and ensuring our operational data in Airtable matches our bookkeeping system (Fortnox). You will help make our margins, inventory days, and KPI dashboards reliable so leadership can make confident decisions.



Key Responsibilities



Financial Controls & Reconciliation

-Run weekly and monthly financial checks to detect

-Missing credits or refunds

-Duplicate or incorrect invoices

-VAT or pricing errors

-Unbilled work or add-ons

-Mismatches between sold cars, payments, and recorded revenues

-Reconcile Airtable with Fortnox (costs, revenues, car-level profitability) and follow up until issues are fully resolved.



Airtable Ownership

-Maintain and improve our Airtable base (fields, formulas, views, and interfaces).

-Ensure data is structured correctly to flag issues early and support accurate reporting.

-Help improve or build automations where useful to reduce manual errors.



KPI Reporting

-Build and maintain a weekly KPI scorecard, including

-Expected vs actual margin per car

-Inventory days

-Reconditioning cost variance

-Add-ons and extra revenues

-Ensure KPIs are accurate, consistent, and easy to understand.



Invoice Pre-Approval & Admin Support

-Perform invoice pre-approval before final approval

-Verify invoices against internal operational updates (e.g. work completed by partners or contractors)

-Resolve unclear items directly with the relevant team or external partner before escalation

-Support admin work with structure, checklists, and follow-ups.



How the Role Evolves



This role will evolve over time. You should be comfortable shifting focus toward the biggest financial or operational problems in the company, ensuring each improvement delivers real impact.



Requirements (Must-Haves)



-Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills with high attention to detail.

-Experience using Airtable (views, formulas, interfaces).

-Comfortable reconciling data across systems and following issues through to completion.

-Good English communication skills.

-Proactive, structured, and reliable.



Nice-to-Haves



-Experience with bookkeeping or accounting systems (Fortnox or similar).

-Background in operations, finance support, or audit-style roles.



Work Setup



-Remote

-Long-term role

-Stable workload with room to grow and take ownership

title: Facebook Ads Specialist – Lean Validation Test (Short-Term Project)

 Ads can generate meaningful traffic or early trial interest. If results are promising, a larger Phase 2 project may follow.

 Ads campaigns

title: Amazon Product Researcher (Online & Retail Arbitrage)
description:
About Us

We are a growing ecommerce business focused on profitable online and retail arbitrage on the Canadian Amazon marketplace. Our goal is to consistently source high-margin products and build a scalable operation. We are seeking a detail-oriented, analytical, and proactive Product Researcher to help uncover winning opportunities.



Position Overview

As an Amazon Product Researcher, you will be responsible for finding products with strong resale profitability on Amazon Canada. This is a results-driven role — your research directly impacts revenue.

You will work independently using tools such as Keepa and RevSeller to analyze product viability, pricing history, sales performance, and competitive landscape. The role offers flexible hours, allowing you to work when it suits you.



Key Responsibilities

*Conduct product research for online and retail arbitrage

*Analyze pricing history and sales velocity using Keepa

*Evaluate product profitability and ROI using RevSeller

*Screen products for eligibility and compliance with Amazon policies

*Accurately match products between supplier websites and Amazon listings

*Report findings clearly by entering complete and accurate data into Google Sheets

*Communicate progress, issues, and questions clearly via chat/email and regular check-ins



Mandatory Requirements

? Fluent or proficient in written and spoken English

 ? Fast, stable internet connection and a reliable computer

 ? Proven experience with Amazon product research for arbitrage

 ? Strong ability to accurately match products between suppliers and Amazon

 ? Comfortable using Keepa and RevSeller

 ? Ability to analyze ROI, sales rank, pricing history, and competition

 ? Strong analytical skills and exceptional attention to detail

 ? Ability to work independently and manage time effectively

 ? Willingness to learn quickly and take feedback seriously



Nice to Have

? Familiarity with Canadian marketplace nuances, including pricing differences, seasonal trends, stock availability, and common retail/online sources



Salary & Hours

*Starting at $3–$5 USD per hour (part-time)

*Rate depends on experience and performance

*5-hour paid trial period during the first week

*10 hours/week guaranteed after successful completion of the trial

*Opportunity for rate increases and transition to full-time based on results



What You’ll Get

? Fully remote role

? Flexible work schedule

? Guaranteed hours after trial period

? Performance-based growth opportunities

? Supportive, long-term collaboration



How to Apply

*Please submit the following:

-Your CV/Resume

-A short introduction describing your Amazon product research experience

-A brief list of tools you’ve used

-Examples of past product leads you’ve sourced



In your application
, start your message with the word “Maple” so we know you read the full job post.



NOTE: You will be asked to complete a short sample task. Successful completion is required before being offered a role.



Application subject line:

 Amazon Product Research VA – [Your Name]



Optional (but a big plus):

 Include a short 1–3 minute video introducing yourself and explaining your Amazon VA experience.



We are looking for someone who wants to grow with us long-term. If you are detail-oriented, comfortable with numbers, and experienced in Amazon product research, we would love to hear from you.

title: Financial Analyst (Financial Modelling)
description:
We are looking a Financial Analyst to join our finance team. This role is ideal for professionals with deep experience in financial modeling and business analysis. You will play a critical role in building financial forecasts, developing performance metrics, and providing strategic insights to senior leadership.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Financial Modeling & Forecasting

• Develop three-statement financial models (Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow).

• Design forecast models to project company performance across multiple scenarios.



2. Performance Analysis & Reporting

• Prepare and interpret monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports for executive management.

• Conduct variance analysis versus budget and prior year results.

• Identify key financial and operational trends, risks, and opportunities.



3. Financial Operations & Assumptions Management

• Maintain an assumptions register detailing growth drivers, debt amortization, and revenue recognition logic.

• Support CapEx and debt planning, including modeling amortization schedules and cash flow impacts.

• Ensure financial models align with accounting principles and internal controls.



Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field (MBA or CPA preferred).

• 5+ years of progressive experience in FP&A, corporate finance, or investment analysis, preferably in a SaaS or tech environment.

• Strong command of Excel-based modeling and proficiency in visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).



Share the link to your resume.

title: Direct Response Copywriter for eCommerce (DTC Health & Wellness)
description:
We're a growing DTC supplement brand looking for a Direct Response Copywriter who doesn't just write copy, they study it. Someone who actively collects and analyzes winning ads as part of how they think. Someone who can look at a Meta Ad Library page and tell you exactly why the top-spending creative works.



This isn't a "write nice words" role. You'll be writing ads, VSLs, landing pages, and advertorials, all measured by real numbers. CTR, CPA, ROAS, AOV. Your words either move the needle or they don't. 



You'll work closely with our marketing team, graphic designers, and video editors to produce high-volume, high-quality direct response assets for our brand. You'll research deeply, write fast, iterate based on data, and build a system for producing winners consistently.





What you'll actually do day-to-day:

* Write Meta ad scripts (short-form, long-form, UGC briefs, statics) at volume

* Write and optimize VSLs, landing pages, and advertorials

* Conduct deep avatar, competitor, and market research to fuel fresh angles

* Analyze ad performance data and use it to guide your next creative decisions

* Develop hooks, mechanisms, and positioning that differentiate — while staying compliant

* Use AI tools intelligently to speed up research and iteration — without losing the human edge



What we're looking for:

* 3+ years of direct response copywriting experience (DTC health, wellness, or supplements strongly preferred)

* A portfolio that shows real DR work — ads, VSLs, landing pages, not brand fluff

* You understand hooks, angles, and mechanisms and why they matter

* You've used performance data to iterate on your own copy

* You know your way around Meta Ads Manager metrics

* You can write fast, take feedback, and care more about results than ego



This role is full-time and requires full professional focus. No moonlighting, no freelance side gigs, no split attention. We invest in our people and expect the same commitment back.



Click here to apply :

title: SEO Manager (Healthcare Clients) – Pulse Digital Health
description:
Pulse Digital Health (www.pulsedigital.health) is a specialist digital agency focused on healthcare clinics and medical brands in the UK. We are looking for an experienced SEO Manager to lead and execute SEO for multiple healthcare clients.



Role overview

You will own SEO strategy and implementation for a portfolio of healthcare clients, managing projects from initial audit and strategy through to ongoing optimisation, reporting, and performance improvements. You’ll collaborate with our content writer and wider team, but you will be the person ultimately responsible for SEO results.



Key responsibilities

- Develop and implement end?to?end SEO strategies for multiple healthcare clients (on?page, off?page, and technical).

- Conduct keyword research, competitor analysis, and opportunity identification aligned with each client’s services and locations.

- Perform SEO audits (technical, on?page, site structure) and create clear action plans.

- Brief and collaborate with our content writer on SEO?led content topics, outlines, and optimisation requirements (you do not need to write content yourself).

- Optimise landing pages, service pages, and blog content for rankings, traffic, and conversions.

- Manage and monitor technical SEO issues (indexation, crawlability, page speed, internal linking, schema, etc.) and coordinate with developers when needed.

- Set up and maintain performance tracking using tools such as Google Analytics/GA4, Google Search Console, and other SEO platforms.

- Produce regular performance reports for clients, with clear insights and recommended next steps.

- Take full ownership of SEO projects from start to finish, ensuring tasks are prioritised, delivered on time, and aligned with client goals.



Requirements

- Minimum of 2 years’ hands?on SEO experience, ideally in an agency or across multiple websites.

- Strong analytical skills, comfortable working with data, performance reports, and identifying actionable insights.

- Demonstrated experience managing SEO projects end?to?end (audit, strategy, implementation, reporting).

- Solid understanding of on?page, technical, and off?page SEO best practices.

- Experience with common SEO and analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics/GA4, Google Search Console, keyword research tools, rank tracking tools).

- Strong organisational and project management skills; able to manage multiple clients and deadlines.

- Good written and spoken English, especially for communicating insights and recommendations clearly.

- Experience with healthcare, medical, or local service businesses is a plus (but not essential).

- Agency experience strongly welcomed.



Working hours and arrangement

- Full?time (5 days per week) or part?time (4 days per week) options available.

- You must be able to work during UK office hours.

- Remote role, working closely with the Pulse Digital Health team.

- Please note that this should be your main job, not a job on the side.



How to apply

Please send:

- Your CV or a link to your LinkedIn profile/portfolio.

- A brief description of your most relevant SEO experience (especially with service?based or healthcare clients, if applicable).

- 2–3 examples of projects where you managed SEO from start to finish and the results achieved.

- Your expected monthly pay (for 4?day or 5?day per week arrangements, specify both if you are open to either).



Applications without a clear expected pay will not be considered.

Role overview

- Ability to communicate clearly and confidently with both clients and internal team members.

Working hours and arrangements

How to apply

title: Content Writer (Healthcare Articles) – Pulse Digital Health
description:
Pulse Digital Health (www.pulsedigital.health) is a specialist digital agency focused on healthcare clinics and medical brands in the UK. We are looking for a highly skilled Content Writer with strong healthcare writing experience and native?level English to create clear, engaging, and accurate articles for our clients.



Role overview

You will write high?quality, patient?friendly and clinician?appropriate articles for healthcare clients, covering medical conditions, treatments, procedures, and clinic services. This is an article?based role: you will be paid per article (or per 100 words), and you will work closely with our SEO and strategy team who will provide topics, briefs, and key points to cover.



Key responsibilities

- Write clear, accurate, and engaging healthcare articles based on detailed briefs (conditions, treatments, clinics, and patient information).

- Take complex medical information and turn it into content that is easy for patients and the public to understand while remaining accurate and responsible.

- Follow brand voice, style, and tone guidelines for different clinics and healthcare providers.

- Incorporate SEO guidelines provided by our SEO team (keywords, headings, structure, internal links) in a natural and reader?friendly way.

- Fact?check content using reputable clinical and healthcare sources and ensure claims are appropriate and responsible.

- Revise content based on feedback from our team or clients and maintain high editorial standards.



Requirements

- Proven experience writing healthcare or medical content (for clinics, hospitals, health brands, or health publishers).

- Native?level English, with excellent grammar, clarity, and flow.

- Strong portfolio of healthcare?related articles or similar content (please include links or samples).

- Ability to follow structured briefs and write to specific SEO and formatting guidelines.

- Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy and sensitivity in medical topics.

- Ability to meet deadlines and manage multiple article assignments.



Working arrangement and payment

- Freelance / per?article arrangement.

, TikTok, Instagram)

title: Operations Executive
description:
Apply here: 





About Our Team

Amplified Marketing is a Singapore-based AI-powered lead generation and appointment setting agency. We help financial advisors build real, consistent acquisition channels, blending smart automation with genuine human connection. We've doubled in a single year, and we're just getting started.



We're a small, tight-knit team that actually cares, about our work, about our clients, and about each other. Your work here will be seen, felt, and celebrated.



Why This Role Exists

We're growing fast, and we need someone who can hold the operational heart of the business together. Not someone who waits to be told what to do but someone who looks at a situation, understands what's happening, and figures out what needs to be done next. Someone who thinks.



This role is for a Project Executive who can own our day-to-day operations, support client campaigns, manage communication, and keep everything running smoothly, all without needing to be micromanaged every step of the way.



What You'll Be Doing

 • Manage and track ongoing client campaigns across multiple financial advisor accounts

 • Coordinate tasks between tea
mbers and ensure nothing slips through the cracks

 • Handle client communication professionally, including tricky conversations, with warmth and clarity

 • Maintain project boards in Notion or ClickUp, keeping workflows clean and up to date

 • Manage calendars, shared inboxes, and key admin using Google Workspace

 • Review deliverables and proactively flag issues before they become problems

 • Help manage social media scheduling and content coordination

 • Identify workflow gaps and suggest improvements, without being asked



You're the One If You...

 • Can look at a situation and figure out what's wrong, even when no one tells you something is wrong

 • Take ownership of your work and follow through without needing reminders

 • Communicate clearly and make people feel heard, even under pressure

 • Are meticulous, you notice the small things that others miss

 • Have 1–2+ years in ops, project coordination, or a similar role

 • Are comfortable with Google Workspace and tools like Notion or ClickUp

 • Thrive in a lean, remote team where you're trusted to figure things out



Bonus Points If You...

 • Have worked in a digital marketing agency or financial services environment

 • Have experience with automation tools like 
 or Zapier, GoHighLevel

 • Are curious about AI and how it's reshaping how businesses operate

 • Have managed WhatsApp-based client communication or CRM workflows before



A Note on How We Hire

We don't hire based on CVs alone. We hire based on how you think. Our application includes a short set of questions, some practical, some situational, that give us a real picture of who you are and how your mind works.

One thing we'll tell you upfront: if you use AI to answer the questions, you'll be disqualified. We're an AI automation agency, we'll know. We want YOUR answers, YOUR voice, YOUR thinking.



It takes about 5–10 minutes. We read every single submission personally.



Compensation & Details

 • Starting salary: $
USD/month (reviewed and grown based on your performance)

 • Hours: Full-time, 40 hours/week

 • Location: Fully remote work from wherever feels like home

 • Start date: As soon as possible



Our Story So Far

 • Helped a Singapore service business scale from $2.6M to $5.7M SGD in revenue

 • Built Singapore's first agency combining digital marketing with AI-powered WhatsApp conversations



Ready to Be Part of Something Real?

We're not looking for someone to fill a seat. We're looking for someone who will grow with us, challenge us to be better, and take genuine pride in the work they do.

If that's you, we'd love to hear from you.

Apply here: 



Position Details

 • Job Type: Full-time

 • Work Style: Remote work from anywhere

 • Schedule: 40 hours/week

 • Experience: 1–2 years in operations or project coordination (required)

 • Tools: Google Workspace (required), Notion or ClickUp (required)

 • Language: English — strong written and verbal communication (required)

 • Perks: Opportunities for promotion, professional development, work from home

title: Australian Accountant
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Advanced Australian Tax Preparer with deep experience in individual, partnership, trust, company, and SMSF returns to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone who can work with minimal supervision, manage complex tax scenarios, and provide high-quality compliance support to Australian clients.



About the Role



You will be responsible for preparing and reviewing a wide range of Australian tax returns, ensuring compliance with ATO standards, and supporting advisory teams with reconciliations, research, and documentation.



Key Responsibilities



Compliance & Lodgements

• Prepare and review Individual (I), Company (C), Trust (T), Partnership (P), and SMSF tax returns.

• Handle BAS, IAS, PAYG, and FBT returns, including complex adjustments.

• Ensure complete and compliant workpapers aligned with ATO regulations.



Advanced Technical Work

• Process multi-entity structures, including discretionary trusts and family groups.

• Perform Tax Reconciliation, Profit to Tax adjustments, and Deferred Tax calculations.

• Analyse Division 7A, UPEs, loans, and minimum repayments.

• Identify tax planning opportunities and highlight risks to senior accountants.



Software & Systems

• Work efficiently using Xero Practice Manager, Xero Tax, MYOB AE, APS, HandiTax, and Class/SimpleFund360.



Qualifications & Experience

• Minimum 3–5+ years of Australian tax preparation experience (public practice preferred).

• Strong understanding of Australian Tax Law, ATO rulings, GST, FBT, and SMSF regulations.

• Experience handling high-volume and complex tax files.

• Accounting degree required; CPA/CA qualifications are highly valued.



Skills We’re Looking For

• Strong analytical and technical tax skills.

• Advanced knowledge of ATO compliance frameworks.

• High attention to detail with consistent accuracy.

• Ability to explain complex tax issues in simple, client-friendly language.

• Excellent time management and independence in remote work.



How to Apply



Send a short cover letter and Google Drive link to your resume. Make sure to make the link accessible to everyone.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Full-Time | Remote | Competitive Compensation



We are looking for a Financial Analyst / FP&A to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who loves turning data into insights, building models, and helping leadership make smarter, faster decisions.



What You’ll Do

 • Build, maintain, and improve dynamic financial models, forecasts, and dashboards.

 • Analyze P&L trends, variances, revenue drivers, and cost structures.

 • Support budgeting, quarterly reforecasting, and long-range planning processes.

 • Prepare management reports, KPI scorecards, and investor-ready financial summaries.

 • Conduct scenario analysis, sensitivity modeling, and performance deep-dives.

 • Partner with cross-functional teams (Operations, Sales, Marketing, Product) to understand business performance and financial impact.

 • Evaluate new projects, business cases, pricing strategies, and investment opportunities.

 • Identify risks, opportunities, and actionable recommendations to improve financial outcomes.



What We’re Looking For

 • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related field.

 • 3–5+ years of experience in Financial Analysis, FP&A, or Corporate Finance.

 • Strong proficiency in Excel / Google Sheets; financial modeling is a must.

 • Experience with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, etc.) is a plus.

 • Solid understanding of financial statements, budgeting, forecasts, and variance analysis.

 • Sharp analytical skills with the ability to simplify complex data.

 • Strong business acumen and communication skills—you can translate numbers into insights.

title: Level 3 IT Support Technician
description:
About the Role



We are a growing Managed Service Provider (MSP) based in Perth, Western Australia, and we are looking for a skilled and dedicated Level 3 IT Support Technician to join our team. In this role, you will provide technical support to a diverse client base, handling a variety of issues and working across a range of services including Microsoft and MSP toolsets.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work with an Australian MSP, grow your technical skills, and be part of a supportive and collaborative team.



Key Responsibilities



    • Provide Level 3 technical support to clients via ConnectWise ticketing platform, including troubleshooting, escalation management, and resolution.

    • Monitor and manage client environments using N-able Ncentral, including patch management, alerting, and remote remediation.

    • Administer and support Microsoft 365 environments including Exchange Online, Teams, SharePoint, and licensing.

    • Manage and support Windows 11 desktop environments - configuration, troubleshooting and deployment.

    • Administer Windows Server environments including installation, configuration, updates, and performance monitoring of Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, NPS, RADIUS and IIS server roles. 

    • Manage Active Directory tasks including user provisioning, group policies, OU structures, and password resets.

    • Collaborate with other technicians to provide guidance and escalation support.

    • Document procedures, client configurations, and ticket resolutions accurately in the PSA system.

    • Participate in tea
etings and contribute to a positive and professional work culture.



Required Experience & Skills



    • Hands-on experience with ConnectWise Manage in an MSP environment.

    • Proficiency with N-able N-central for remote monitoring and management.

    • Solid experience administering Microsoft 365 (Exchange Online, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Entra and Azure AD).

    • Strong knowledge of Windows 11 desktop - deployment, troubleshooting, and end-user support.

    • Experience with Windows Server (2016/2019/2022) - roles, features, and general administration.

    • Active Directory administration - user accounts, group policy, DNS, and DHCP.

    • Minimum 3 - 5 years of IT support experience, preferably within an MSP.



Personal Attributes



    • A true team player who actively supports colleagues and contributes to a collaborative environment.

    • Excellent English communication skills - both written and verbal - with the ability to communicate clearly with Australian clients and internal staff.

    • High level of attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in documentation, configurations, and client communications.

    • Self-motivated and able to manage time effectively in a remote work setting.

    • Professional and client-focused approach with a positive attitude.



What We Offer



    • Competitive salary based on experience.

    • Work-from-home flexibility.

    • Opportunity to work with a friendly, tight-knit Australian MSP team.

    • Exposure to a wide range of technologies and client environments.

    • Career growth and professional development opportunities.



How to Apply



If you have the skills and experience we are looking for and are excited about joining an Australian MSP team, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your updated CV along with a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this role.



We look forward to welcoming a talented technician to our team!

title: Mortgage and Insurance Administrator
description:
Location: London (Hybrid)

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Competitive, dependent on experience



About Us



We are a growing London-based mortgage brokerage providing tailored mortgage and protection advice to a wide range of clients. We are not a purely profit driven business. Our aim is to develop a brokerage with a strong team ethos Our focus is on delivering outstanding customer service while maintaining the highest standards of compliance and professionalism.



We are now seeking an organised and proactive Mortgage & Insurance Administrator to support our advisers and help deliver a seamless client journey from enquiry through to completion.



The Role



You will play a key role in managing mortgage and insurance cases from start to finish, acting as a central point of contact for clients, lenders, solicitors, and insurers.



This is an excellent opportunity for someone with experience in mortgage administration who enjoys working in a fast-paced, client-focused environment.



Key Responsibilities

Mortgage Administration



Processing mortgage applications from submission to completion



Gathering, checking, and uploading client documentation



Liaising with lenders, solicitors, estate agents, and surveyors



Tracking case progress and proactively chasing outstanding items



Updating CRM systems and maintaining accurate client records



Preparing suitability packs and client correspondence



Supporting advisers with fact-finds and application packaging



Insurance / Protection Administration:



* Processing life insurance, income protection, and general insurance applications



* Following up on underwriting requirements



* Issuing policy documents and confirmation to clients



* Maintaining insurer relationships and tracking policy statuses



Client Support



* Providing excellent customer service via phone and



* Keeping clients informed throughout their journey



* Handling general enquiries and resolving issues professionally



Compliance & Office Support



* Ensuring all files meet FCA and internal compliance standards



* Maintaining document management systems



* Supporting general office administration when required



Skills & Experience Required



Essential:



* Previous experience in mortgage administration (brokerage environment preferred)



* Strong organisational and time-management skills



* Excellent written and verbal communication



* High attention to detail



* Confidence dealing directly with clients



* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM systems



Desirable:



* Experience with protection / insurance administration



* Knowledge of UK mortgage processes and lenders



* Familiarity with FCA compliance requirements



Personal Attributes



* Professional and approachable manner



* Self-motivated and able to work independently



* Calm under pressure with strong prioritisation skills



* Team player with a positive attitude



* Client-focused mindset



What We Offer



* Competitive salary based on experience



* Supportive and friendly working environment

title: US STR Deal Sourcing Virtual Assistant
description:
Important: Apply ONLY if you have direct, hands-on experience in the US Short-Term Rental market.



About the Role:



We are aggressively expanding into the US Short-Term Rental (STR) market and are looking for a highly experienced Virtual Assistant with real, practical exposure to US STR property sourcing and deal analysis.



This is not a beginner or general real estate VA role.



We are specifically looking for someone who has:



Worked with US Airbnb/Vrbo listings



Sourced STR properties in US markets



Analyzed STR deals using data tools



Understood US zoning & regulations



Communicated with US landlords/brokers



You will work directly with the founder and play a key role in building and scaling our US portfolio.



If you have not worked with US-based STR properties, this role is not a fit.





Key Responsibilities:



Conduct deep research on US STR markets (regulations, zoning, seasonality, ADR, occupancy, comps)



Identify STR-friendly cities and buildings



Source STR properties via rental arbitrage, MLS research, direct outreach, and owner contact



Analyze deals using AirDNA, Mashvisor, AllTheRooms, etc.



Prepare deal summaries and financial feasibility projections



Maintain a structured deal pipeline with follow-ups



Coordinate communication with US landlords, brokers, and agents



Support expansion planning and market entry strategy



Manage reporting, spreadsheets, and documentation





Mandatory Experience (Read Carefully)



You MUST have:



Proven experience working in the US STR market



Hands-on Airbnb and/or Vrbo exposure (US listings)



Direct involvement in sourcing, rental arbitrage, or STR investment analysis (Strongly Preferred)



Experience using AirDNA, Mashvisor, AllTheRooms



Understanding of US city-level STR regulations



Experience speaking with US landlords and brokers



Do NOT apply if:



Your experience is outside the US



You only handled guest communication



You are new to STR or still learning





Skills Required:



Excellent English communication (written and spoken)



Strong analytical and financial evaluation skills



Research-driven and detail-oriented



Highly organized and proactive



Comfortable working independently



Reliable internet and professional setup



Long-term mindset



Compensation & Incentives





We offer:



Competitive fixed salary based on real US STR experience



Performance incentives for every property successfully closed





Incentive Structure:



Fixed bonus for each STR property successfully added to portfolio



Higher incentive for premium markets or multi-unit buildings



Monthly performance bonuses based on number of qualified deals sourced



Unlimited earning potential — the more deals you close, the more you earn



This is not just a salary-based role — this is a growth-based opportunity.



Top performers can significantly increase their monthly earnings based on deal flow and portfolio expansion.



Long-Term Opportunity



Direct exposure to founder-level strategic decisions



Core team member potential



Long-term stable remote role



Real growth path in US STR expansion





How to Apply (Mandatory)



To be considered, you must include:



Updated resume



Short note explaining your US STR experience



Examples of US STR deals, properties, or markets you worked on



Tools you’ve used (AirDNA, Mashvisor, etc.)



Applications without clear US STR experience will not be reviewed.

title: CNC Programmer
description:
Position: Fusion 360 CNC Programmer (Remote – Philippines)



We are seeking a skilled CNC Programmer based in the Philippines to join our team. This role focuses on CAM programming using Fusion 360 for real-world manufacturing applications.



Requirements



Proficient in Autodesk Fusion 360 (CAM required)



Strong understanding of CNC machining principles



Experience generating toolpaths for 3-axis mills (additional experience is a plus)



Ability to select appropriate tooling, feeds, and speeds



Strong understanding of work offsets, origins, and post-processing



Ability to review models for manufacturability



Must speak and write in perfect English



Must have a stable, high-speed internet connection



Reliable computer capable of running Fusion 360 efficiently



Daily Expectations



Attend one required daily meeting at 8:00 AM Chicago time



Communicate consistently via Slack



Deliver clean, organized CAM files



Follow structured programming workflows



Ask questions when assumptions need clarification



Preferred (Not Required)



Real-world CNC machining experience



Experience working directly with machine operators



Fixture design or setup experience



Experience reviewing and editing G-code



This role requires attention to detail, consistency, and strong communication. We are looking for someone who understands that CAM programming directly impacts real machines and real parts.



If interested, please submit examples of previous Fusion 360 CAM work and briefly describe your CNC experience.

title: Paid Ads Specialist
description:
Role Overview



We are seeking a Paid Ads Specialist to manage, optimize, and support our paid advertising initiatives, with a primary focus on eBay Ads and Google Ads. This role is ideal for a performance-driven marketer who can handle daily ad spend responsibly, collaborate closely with the team manager, and provide data-driven insights to support business growth.



The specialist will provide regular updates, insights, and recommendations to the team manager and will scale, pause, or adjust campaigns only with prior approval. While eBay and Google Ads will be the main responsibility, the role may also support Meta Ads and other external marketing initiatives when needed, particularly during periods of high workload.



Key Responsibilities:



•Plan, create, manage, and optimize paid advertising campaigns primarily on eBay Ads and Google Ads

•Support Meta Ads campaigns as needed to ensure continuity and performance when required

•Monitor daily ad spend, campaign performance, budgets, and key metrics to improve conversions and return on ad spend (ROAS)

•Conduct audience research, keyword research, and ongoing A/B testing of ads

•Optimize ad creatives, copy, targeting, and bidding strategies based on performance data

•Provide regular performance updates, insights, and reports to the team manager

•Scale, pause, or adjust campaigns only after review and approval from the manager

•Identify opportunities for growth, efficiency, and testing across paid advertising channels

•Stay up to date with platform updates, advertising trends, and best practices

•Occasionally assist with other external marketing advertisements or promotional initiatives



Requirements:

•More than 1 year of hands-on experience managing eBay Ads and Google Ads (required)

•Experience handling daily ad spend and budget optimization across paid platforms

•Strong understanding of e-commerce advertising and performance analytics

•Familiarity with campaign scaling strategies and budget management

title: Product Development Manager
description:
Position Overview:

The Product Development Manager plays a central role in managing distributor relationships and leading product development initiatives across various markets. This role ensures the seamless execution of projects from ideation to delivery, maintaining high standards for product quality, project timelines, and profitability. The manager also spearheads private label programs, optimizes e-commerce platforms, and supports cross-functional collaboration with sales, marketing, logistics, and supply chain teams to drive operational success.

 

Key Responsibilities:

Manage and maintain distributor accounts via
 and scheduled meetings.

Oversee full-cycle product development for new and existing items, ensuring quality, profitability, and timely delivery.

Lead private label product development, including design, costing, supplier coordination, and timeline execution.

Coordinate with suppliers, factories, and internal departments to execute purchase orders and monitor production timelines.

Communicate order statuses and shipping updates to clients.

Investigate and resolve client quality issues through factory coordination and timely feedback.

Manage Rare Candy’s product listings, pricing, and customer service inquiries.

Develop and maintain sales tracking tools to monitor performance and listing effectiveness.

Supervise and support the sales department in targeting clients and preparing product specifications.

Guide the sales team in building strong business relationships with professionalism and strategic intent.

Collaborate with the marketing, design, and Shopify teams for successful product launches and branding.

Source, evaluate, and manage supplier relationships to ensure favorable terms and consistent quality.

Ensure accurate product information, photo assets, and listings across platforms and departments.

Qualifications:

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Product Development, or a related field.

Minimum of 3–5 years experience in product development, account management, or a similar role.

Proven experience in managing cross-functional teams and projects in a product-driven business.

 

Skills & Competencies

Strong project management and organizational skills.

Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.

Strategic thinker with an eye for detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines while maintaining high-quality standards.

Skilled in supplier negotiation and relationship management, especially in global markets.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data to drive decisions and improvements.

Experience in handling e-commerce platforms and product listing management is a plus.



Preferred:

Experience working with international suppliers and distributors (e.g., U.S., Europe, Middle East).

Familiarity with private label development and quality assurance protocols.

Proficiency in Canva, Shopify, and project management platforms.

 

Collaboration & Reporting

Product Development Team – For managing timelines, product quality, and execution of new and existing items.

Sales Team – To align on client requirements, develop product specifications, and support strategic outreach efforts.

Marketing Team – To coordinate product launches, promotional materials, and ensure brand consistency.

Design Team – For packaging layouts, 3D mockups, and product visuals that meet branding and client expectations.

Shopify & E-commerce Team – To ensure accurate product listings, pricing updates, and availability of photo assets.

Supply Chain Team – To coordinate production schedules, monitor factory output, and ensure integration with inventory systems.

Warehouse & Logistics Team (China) – For shipping coordination, order fulfillment, and inventory tracking.

Suppliers & Manufacturers – To manage production, negotiate terms, resolve quality concerns, and ensure timely delivery.

title: Master Data & Systems Manager
description:
About the Role



We are looking for a highly detail-oriented Inventory Systems Manager to own our SKU master data, inventory systems, pricing logic, and system integrations across all sales channels (B2C & B2B).



This role is critical to ensuring accurate data flow from factory ? 3PL ? Shopify ? distributors, supporting inventory accuracy, pricing integrity, and operational efficiency as we scale.



Key Responsibilities:



1.Master Data & Systems Ownership



-Own and maintain SKU master data, including:

 • SKU codes

 • Case packs & inner packs

 • HS codes

 • Product dimensions & weights

 • Product categories

-Validate all data prior to system entry with a zero-error mindset

-Lead the CIN7 implementation and optimization (medium-term):

 • Centralize inventory, pricing, case packs, and sales channels

 • Define system rules (unit vs case, MOQ, bundles, kits)

-Configure, maintain, and troubleshoot system integrations:

 • CIN7

 • Shopify inventory sync

 • ShipHero



2.Inventory & Operations

-Support inventory forecasting and replenishment planning

-Partner closely with the Account Controller / Finance on:

 • COGS accuracy

 • Landed cost calculations

 • Margin validation

-Ensure accurate receiving and compliance with 3PL:

 • Quantity validation

 • Case pack compliance

 • Damage and discrepancy reporting



3.Pricing & Sales Channels

-Build, maintain, and validate price lists for:

 • B2C (Shopify, Amazon)

 • Retail partners

 • Distributors

 • US vs Canada markets

-Apply and enforce pricing rules by channel:

 • MSRP

 • Wholesale tiers

 • Distributor margins

-Support B2C USA channel setup and ongoing operations



4.Order Management (B2B)

-Create and manage distributor orders in the system

-Validate all orders for:

 • Correct pricing

 • Case pack logic

 • Shipping and fulfillment rules

-Ensure order accuracy before release to fulfillment



5.Escalation & Issue Resolution

-Act as the primary escalation point for:

 • B2C issues

 • B2B issues

 • Inventory discrepancies

-Serve as the main point of contact with the Canada 3PL

-Ensure issues are documented, tracked, and resolved efficiently



Qualifications & Experience:

-Proven experience managing inventory and operational systems

-Hands-on experience with:

-CIN7, NetSuite, TradeGecko, or similar ERP/inventory platforms

-Shopify

-3PL operations and integrations

-Strong numerical and analytical skills

-Experience supporting B2B and B2C sales channels

-Highly process-driven, structured, and reliable

-Exceptional attention to detail and data accuracy



Key Traits for Success:

-Extremely detail-oriented (“nothing slips through” mindset)

-Comfortable working with systems, data, and pricing logic

-Proactive problem solver

-Able to work cross-functionally with Operations, Finance, Sales, and 3PL partners

-Thrives in a fast-growing, scaling environment

title: We're Hiring a TikTok & Instagram Viral Content Poster — Run 3–5 Accounts, Get Paid When Videos Blow Up
description:
About the Role

We're growing a women's dating intelligence app using high-volume short-form content on TikTok and Instagram.

This is not a traditional social media manager role.

You will be running 3–5 accounts and posting 2–3 videos per account, every single day. That's up to 15 videos going live daily. Your job is to find what goes viral, double down on it, and keep the machine running.

If you understand hooks, POVs, trending audio, and how the TikTok algorithm actually works — this role was built for you.



What You'll Do



Manage 3–5 TikTok and/or Instagram accounts simultaneously

Post 2–3 short-form videos per account per day (6–15 videos daily)

Edit videos using CapCut (simple cuts, captions, on-screen text)

Recreate and adapt viral formats using hooks and briefs we provide

Track 24-hour view performance on every video posted

Report weekly on what's working and what's not





What You Won't Do



No long captions or corporate content

No branding decks or strategy documents

No buying followers, views, or fake engagement (see penalty clause below)

No micromanaging creators — you execute and iterate





Requirements



Proven experience posting viral TikToks or Reels (send links)

Deep understanding of hooks, pacing, trending audio, and on-screen text

Comfortable managing multiple accounts at the same time

Fast executor — done is better than perfect

Knows how to adapt content, not copy-paste it

Reliable internet and available during agreed posting windows



Bonus (Not Required)



Experience with niche, 
, or POV pages

Dating / relationship / women's lifestyle content background

Experience growing accounts from scratch





Pay Structure

Base Retainer

$400/month — paid to keep you consistent and committed.

Performance Bonuses (per video)

MilestoneBonus100,000 views$50500,000 views$1501,000,000 views$5005,000,000 views$2,000

Bonuses are per video and uncapped. A strong month with multiple viral videos could earn you significantly more than your base.



?? Integrity Clause — Read This Before Applying

We track all account analytics closely. Buying views, followers, or engagement of any kind is grounds for:



Immediate termination with no notice

Forfeiture of all unpaid bonuses

Repayment of any bonus already paid for that specific video



We're building something real. We only want people who want to build it with us the right way.



How to Apply

Send the following to [INSERT
 / APPLICATION LINK]:



Links to TikTok or Instagram accounts you've posted on or managed

A short paragraph (5–10 sentences): How do you make content go viral? Walk us through your process.

Confirm you accept the $400/month base + performance bonus structure



Applications without video examples will not be considered.

title: WE NEED A VIDEO EDITOR FOR THE FASTEST-GROWING UGC CREATOR BRAND. MULTIPLE REELS OVER 3 MILLION VIEWS
description:
WE NEED A VIDEO EDITOR FOR THE FASTEST-GROWING UGC CREATOR BRAND. MULTIPLE REELS OVER 3 MILLION VIEWS



We are UGC World. The largest UGC creator training and agency placement program in the world. Our organic content is what drives everything. 180,000+ followers on our main account, multiple viral reels, and a YouTube presence across 4 channels. We are now scaling content output significantly and need an editor who can keep up.



Examples of our content:



- https://www.instagram.com/gloriastonelake/reel/DPxa6H5EgL2/

- https://www.instagram.com/gloriastonelake/reel/DPsiCg2kmDQ/

- https://www.instagram.com/gloriastonelake/reel/DTFZ1evkp1d/

- https://www.youtube.com/@GloriaStonelake



What you'll be editing:



- Short-form: Reels, TikToks, and YouTube Shorts (30–90 seconds). Hook-driven, retention-optimized, trend-aware

- Long-form: YouTube videos and VSLs (10–30 minutes). Story-driven, binge-worthy, conversion-focused

- Daily pipeline: 1 long-form video + 3+ reels per day



What you're joining:

You'll be part of an existing editing team with a dedicated content manager. The content department is headed by one of our founders (Gloria).



What we need:



- Strong portfolio. Show us work you're proud of and tell us what it performed

- Mastery of Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve for long-form. CapCut or Premiere for short-form

- You understand retention: hooks, pacing, captions, zooms, B-roll, memes

- Fast turnaround: 2–3 days per long-form video, same-day or next-day for short-form

- Fluent English. You're editing for a North American/European audience



Comp:



- Base: $1,500/month

- Performance bonuses tied to engagement and content output

- OTE: $2,000+/month

- Long-term full-time role for the right person



To apply:

DM the word EDITOR to @gloriastonelake on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gloriastonelake



Include in your DM: your 3 best short-form edits, your 3 best long-form edits, what you charged for each, and the tools you use.



?? Do NOT apply without a portfolio. Do NOT apply if you need 5 days to turn around a reel. We move fast. Our content is the engine of a $100K/month business and we need someone who treats it that way.
