title: Social Media Manager (Instagram & TikTok) for Ace & Taylor
description:
About Us

Ace & Taylor is a fast-growing D2C e-commerce brand selling premium hair tools across Europe. We focus on high-performing short-form video content and daily organic posting on Instagram and TikTok to grow brand awareness, trust, and sales.



We are currently active in The Netherlands and Belgium and expanding across Europe.



What You’ll Do (Your Core Responsibility)

You will fully own our organic social media presence on Instagram and TikTok.

This means you are responsible for planning, posting, captions, stories, community management (DMs & comments), and daily execution.



This is NOT just scheduling content.

We are looking for someone who can run our social media channels independently and consistently.



Your Weekly Tasks

- Post 1–2 times per day on Instagram & TikTok

- Create strong captions & CTAs (engaging, on-brand, conversion-focused)

- Post daily stories (product usage, UGC, behind the scenes, promos)

- Reply to DMs & comments within 24 hours

- Plan and manage the content calendar

- Repurpose existing videos into social posts

- Coordinate with video editors & creative team

- Track basic performance (views, engagement) and report weekly



We Are Looking For Someone Who

- Has proven experience managing Instagram & TikTok for brands

- Understands short-form content and social media trends

- Can work independently without daily hand-holding

- Is proactive: asks questions if something is unclear

- Is highly organized and consistent with daily posting

- Understands brand tone and can adapt copy per platform



Important (Read Carefully – This Filters Out 90% of Bad Applicants)

We post daily. This role requires consistency and ownership.

If you:

- Miss posting deadlines

- Are inconsistent

- Don’t reply to DMs/comments on time

- Don’t ask questions when confused

- Or treat this as “just scheduling posts”



This will clearly not be a fit.



Paid Test Task (Mandatory)

Before we hire you, we will ask you to complete a paid test task:

- Create a 7-day content plan

- Write captions for 5 posts

- Propose story ideas

This helps both sides see if we’re a good match.



Long-Term Opportunity

If this works well, this can become a long-term collaboration with consistent work, growing responsibility, and higher pay over time.

title: AMAZON OPERATION/ACCOUNT MANAGER
description:
AMAZON OPERATION MANAGER



Position: Amazon Operations Manager / Amazon Expert

Type: Full-Time, Hybrid (Philippines / Preferably Metro Manila or nearby)

Salary: PHP 45,000 – 75,000 / month

Schedule: Flexible Hybrid daytime PH hours



About our Company



We are a Canadian corporation specialized in international trade and e-commerce. We are operating in the global market, and we want to utilize global ecommerce platforms such as Amazon to develop new brands and products and reach out to customers across globe. Our company values professionalism, data-driven decision-making, and long-term partnerships. We are establishing a strong, world-class team in the Philippines.

We're seeking an Amazon Operation Manager who will implement effective growth strategies, help managing day-to-day operations, hiring staff and ensure optimal ROAS (Return on Ad Spend) and profitability.



Role Summary



As the Amazon Operation Manager, you will oversee one or more Amazon seller/vendor accounts, be responsible for strategic planning, day-to-day operations, campaign management, listing optimization, inventory & health monitoring, performance reporting and delivering growth targets. You’ll assist in hiring a Manila based team (PPC specialists, graphic designers, copy/content, operations, data analysts) as contractors or part-time staff.



Key Responsibilities



- Own the Amazon account(s): day-to-day operations, growth roadmap, strategic planning.

- Develop and execute account growth strategy: new product launches, listing optimization (titles, bullets, A+ content), SEO/organic traffic, sponsored ads (Sponsored Products/Brands/Display), DSP where applicable.

- Assist in hiring new tea
mbers in coordination with the owners: you will be the point of contact for the company for the Manila team and will assist in hiring part-time or full-time staff/contractors, freelancers to complete the tasks based on demand.

- Manage other tea
mbers and monitor KPIs: manage and monitor other tea
mbers and coordinate their efforts to achieve the desired outcomes. creative team for imagery/video, buyer for product research, procurement, and inventory planning, PPC specialist for running and optimizing variety of ads campaigns.

- Plan, run, and optimize PPC campaigns in coordination with the PPC specialist: structure, keyword research, match types, negative keyword strategy, bid optimization, budget allocation, ROI/ROAS modelling.

- Monitor and optimize key performance metrics: ACoS (Advertising Cost of Sales), TACoS (Total Advertising Cost of Sales), ROAS, ad conversion rate, organic sales lift, margin impact.

- Provide detailed reports and insights to: weekly/monthly performance review, actionable recommendations, forecast next period.

- Stay up to date with Amazon policy changes, ad product updates, algorithm changes, marketplace shifts and emerging best practices.

- Identify scaling opportunities while ensuring profitability: when to scale spend, when to pull back, how to optimize conversion vs traffic.

- Serve as an account leader for the company: manage expectations, communicate clearly, act proactively on issues (listing suppressions, account health, negative reviews).

- Work with automation/data tools and dashboards: pull/clean data, identify waste/spend inefficiencies, drive process improvement (e.g., by leveraging no-code automations, data pipelines).



Qualifications



- 2+ years of experience managing Amazon seller or vendor accounts (or equivalent e-commerce marketplace experience).

- Strong understanding of Amazon advertising ecosystem: Sponsored Products/Brands/Display, DSP, auto vs manual campaigns, bidding strategies, search term reports.

- Proven ability to improve ROAS/ACoS and profitability for Amazon accounts.

- Excellent analytical skills: ability to interpret data, create actionable insights, optimize campaigns based on performance.

- Experience with Amazon listing optimization: keyword research, SEO, copywriting (titles/bullets/A+), conversion-rate focus.

- Familiarity with Amazon account health, operations, inventory forecasting, and marketplace best practices.

- Comfortable being company-facing: strong communication, presentation skills, managing expectations, building trust. You will be communicating directly with the owners of the company.

- Self-starter, organized, able to manage multiple brands, accounts and projects concurrently.

- Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills; experience with dashboards / BI tools a plus.

- Bonus: experience with automation tools, no-code platforms, AI-driven optimization (a growing focus).



KPIs / Success Measures



- Achieving or exceeding client ROAS/ACoS targets.

- Improvement in organic sales and overall account profitability.

- Reduction in wasted ad spending (negative keywords, inefficient campaigns).

- Client satisfaction and retention (renewals, upsells).

- Timely reporting and proactive account strategy updates.

- Efficient cross-team collaboration and issue resolution (listing suppressions, inventory, reviews, etc.).



What We Offer



- Working directly for a Canadian company with global opportunities

- Collaborative, high-performance environment.

- Competitive salary + performance bonus (tied to KPIs).

- Professional growth path: potentially moving into higher roles and moving to other countries.

- Hybrid opportunity (Mandaluyong City and remotely)

title: Backend Developer (Python & React/Next.js)
description:
IMPORTANT: To be considered for this position, you must apply through our submission portal at 
 . Applications submitted through any other channel (including this platform's built-in apply button) will not be reviewed.



About the role

We're looking for a Backend Developer to join Orban Labs. Junior profiles are welcome; what matters most is that you're organized, methodical, and genuinely eager to learn. You'll work with Python (FastAPI), TypeScript, React, and Next.js, mostly building and maintaining backend services, but you need to understand the frontend well enough to design APIs that actually work for it.



AI-assisted development is part of our workflow. We use AI coding tools under strict methodologies, not as a shortcut but as a disciplined practice. You should be open to this way of working.



What we expect you to know



Designing and building REST APIs: clean contracts, proper validation, solid error handling

Auth flows (authentication & authorization)

Data modeling and persistence (database or file-based storage)

Writing concurrent/async Python without breaking things

React and Next.js beyond the basics

Testing your own code and debugging production issues

Writing clear documentation that other humans can follow

What would set you apart



Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS or similar)

Exposure to distributed systems or end-to-end system design

A feel for performance: knowing when to optimize and when not to

How we evaluate

You'll complete a short two-part technical challenge: one project built entirely by hand, one built with AI tools (with full prompt documentation). We're not testing complexity; we're testing how you think, plan, communicate, and work.

title: Creative Short-Form Video Editor
description:
We’re looking for a creative short-form video editor who lives and breathes modern content.



This role is for a fast-growing personal brand. We are not creating traditional ads. We are creating viral, hook-driven short-form content designed to stop the scroll and build attention at scale.



You need to understand what makes people watch.



We want someone on the cutting edge of short-form trends. Someone who studies what works. Someone who cares deeply about hooks, retention, pacing, subtitles, pattern interrupts, and storytelling.



If you have experience creating high-performing ads or working with big brands on UGC content, that is a huge plus. But this role is about virality and attention, not corporate-style editing.



You should understand how to craft powerful hooks in the first one to three seconds. You should know how to structure short-form content for maximum retention. You should be confident with captions, sound design, pacing, and dynamic edits. You should stay up to date with TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts trends. Most importantly, you should want to constantly improve and test new ideas.



We are looking for someone who wants to grow long term and be part of building something big. There will be consistent work for the right person.



To apply, you must complete the Google Form below. Only applicants who complete the form will be considered.



Application Form: 



If you are serious about building viral content and pushing your editing skills to the next level, apply now.

title: Graphic Designer (Part-time)
description:
We’re hiring a Graphic Designer with real estate experience who understands how to create clean, professional, high-converting visuals across digital and print.



This role is for someone who knows how to design with clarity and purpose. You understand branding, layout, hierarchy, and how visuals influence attention and trust, especially in real estate marketing.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Team Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important, and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just managing marketing campaigns for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have real estate design experience and understand what makes listings visually credible and market-ready? Do you know how to design social posts and brochures that look clean, professional, and on-brand without overcomplicating them? Do you move fast when timelines are tight and still pay attention to spacing, alignment, and small details?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Social & Digital Design

- Design YouTube branding assets including thumbnails, banners, and episode graphics.

- Create Instagram listing posts, announcements, ads, and story graphics.

- Develop and maintain branded social templates for consistent output.



Print Design

- Design real estate yard signs and signage.

- Create listing brochures and marketing flyers.

- Prepare clean, print-ready files with correct sizing and bleed settings.



Real Estate Photo Editing

- Edit listing photos for lighting, color correction, and clarity.

- Clean up images by removing distractions and enhancing presentation.

- Ensure final images look professional while remaining realistic.



Brand Consistency & Organization

- Maintain consistent fonts, colors, and layout standards

- Ensure all visuals align with company branding

- Organize design files clearly for future use



Requirements:

- Proven experience in real estate graphic design, required

- Strong portfolio showing real estate social and print work, required

- Experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Lightroom), or similar tools

- Strong understanding of layout, spacing, and visual hierarchy

- Experience preparing print-ready files

- Experience editing real estate photos

- Ability to work quickly without sacrificing quality

- Strong communication skills

- Ability to follow brand guidelines

- A stable, high-speed internet connection

- Growth mindset



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)

- Light motion graphics

- Understanding of social media performance metrics

- Basic copy awareness (headline spacing, readability, CTA placement)



NOTE: This is a part-time role with the opportunity to grow into a full-time position for the right person.



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.







STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Graphic Designer with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: B2B Associate
description:
We’re growing the Sales team for the North American market and want you to be a part of that journey.

Are you looking for an adventure, one with big responsibility? Do you have experience working with resellers and distributors or international organizations and closing B2B product deals in the mid-market and enterprise space? Then you might be ready to become part of the team that drives BETTERWAY sky-high – worldwide.

Who are we? We are Betterway along with our sister company Beautifier LLC – We are vetted vendor for federal government of United States (CAGE 9PVP2) and also accredited supplier for the state of California, leveraging on our premier global supply chain and manufacturing capabilities with joint venture Lantern Science (Stock No. 831118) in personal care, consumable & health sectors, also strategic partnership alliance with fortune 500 manufacture conglomerate, which allow us to deliver high quality and cost effective product line in the field of home appliance, chemical, copper, metal and industrial related sectors, we have manufacturing facilities located in USA, China, Vietnam, Thailand, Malaysia, Turkey and many more other operation offices worldwide. 

As a associate of B2B Sales, you’ll be identifying, recruiting, and onboarding new partners primary in North America as well as closing business with our partners while achieving a high level of partner satisfaction. We don’t micromanage – we’re looking for an independent, flexible problem solver to join our best-in-class sales team.

What’s so cool about all this? You are joining one of the fastest growing start-up with Silicon Valley DNA – which means you’ll reap the glory of bringing us to the next stage and change the way the business world communicates. We don't believe in a complex hierarchy. We don’t do long approval processes. We just deliver. You will be joining a company with highly skilled, smart, and diverse people who are all overachievers and want to be “the best”.

As an associate of B2B Operation you will:

?Thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment and has a proven track record of achieving robust sales results

?Able to work in the U.S.A time zone, and capable to travel domestically and internationally

?Eager to learn and understand the new market trends and follow it closely

?Bachelor’s degree and/or 3+ years of direct sales management experience within the industrial or consumer staples goods industry

?3+ years of experience leading strategic sales organization, including

?Building and growing B2B and B2C sales channels,

?Building and growing distribution partnerships globally,

?Attracting, developing, and retaining a diverse high-performing sales team that consistently achieves outstanding results

?Implementing and utilizing data-driven analytics and CRM to develop strategy and manage sales tasks, pipeline, and closing data

?Understands  different markets the product is sold in; Industrial, Supermarket, and Government, and is confident in selling across them within the United States and abroad

?Knowledge of sales operations with a focus on continuous improvement

?High attention to detail

?Strategic thinker with ability to execute tactically

?Excellent written and verbal communication skills Unwavering customer focus

?Data driven, process-oriented thinker

?Exercising sound judgment in analyzing and solving problems from multiple, diverse perspectives

?Believes in and supports Betterway’s mission, vision, and values

?Understands and is compassionate about different populations, cultures, and needs

Hiring Process?

If you are interested in this opportunity, please:1, Send your resume to 
 , we will notice you for the interview if there is a potential fit; 2,personal statement indicates why do you think that you are a good fit for this role 3, Interviews by invitation only primarily conducted in English, partially in Chinese might be possible.

What we offer you?

This is a fully remote position, that means you can work from home or when on the go, we offer you the maximum flexibility in exchange for your contribution and performance. The salary for this position will be commensurate with your experience and include an attractive bonus package plus stock option and benefits. All of your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: INSTAGRAM APPOINTMENT SETTER
description:
HIRING: Instagram Appointment Setter + Notion CRM Builder (Remote)



Select PDR is hiring a sharp, organized Instagram Appointment Setter who can also help us build and manage a simple Notion-based CRM to track leads, follow-ups, and booked appointments.



This role is for someone who can turn DMs into scheduled customers and keep everything structured behind the scenes.



We are a fast-growing mobile Paintless Dent Repair company in Texas helping customers remove dents and hail damage without repainting — clean, fast, factory-quality repairs.



Your job is to:

 1. Respond to Instagram leads

 2. Book appointments

 3. Organize everything in Notion



You will help build a system where no lead gets lost.



? Responsibilities



Instagram Appointment Setting

 • Respond to inbound DMs quickly

 • Follow up with leads daily

 • Ask qualifying questions (damage, location, insurance, timeline)

 • Book appointments into our calendar

 • Maintain a friendly, confident tone



Notion CRM Management

 • Build and manage a lead tracker inside Notion

 • Track lead status (New ? Follow-up ? Booked ? Closed)

 • Log customer info + conversation notes

 • Create a simple pipeline/dashboard for daily follow-ups

 • Keep everything clean and organized



?



???? Ideal Candidate

 • Experience with appointment setting or DM sales

 • Strong written English (Spanish is a plus)

 • Comfortable building systems in Notion

 • Extremely organized and consistent

 • Understands follow-up = money

 • Available during business hours (Texas time preferred)



?



???? Tools You’ll Use

 • Instagram DM Inbox

 • Notion (CRM + pipeline tracking)

 • Google Calendar

 • Scripts + training provided



?



???? Compensation



Hourly + bonuses based on appointments booked and pipeline performance.



? $3–$5 per qualified appointment booked

(lead gives info + confirms time+shows up)



? $50–$150 monthly bonus for hitting volume goals:

 • 20 appointments/month = +$50

 • 35 appointments/month = +$100

 • 50+ appointments/month = +$150



?



???? How to Apply



Send:

 1. A short intro

 2. Any experience with IG appointment setting

 3. A screenshot or example of a Notion workspace you’ve built (if available)

 4. Your weekly availability

 5. Why you’d be a great fit for Select PDR

title: Appointment Setters
description:
This is a pure appointment-setting role.



You will:

• Follow up with warm and cold leads

• Qualify prospects using a simple script

• Book qualified calls onto a calendar

• Update Google Sheets accurately



You will NOT:

• Close sales

• Handle payments

• Provide customer support

• Freelance or improvise scripts



This role is evaluated on:

• Appointments taken (not booked)

• Show-up rate

• Sheet accuracy



High performers are placed into pods and scaled.



This role requires confidence on the phone. If you are uncomfortable speaking with business owners or following scripts exactly, do not apply.



Trial Process

• Short written qualification

• 3 role-play responses (text only)

• If approved, you receive a paid starter batch

• Performance on that batch determines long-term placement



Q1 — Have you set appointments before?

If yes, what type of offers and how many per day?



Q2 — Are you comfortable following a script exactly without improvising?



Q3 — On a scale of 1–10, how comfortable are you speaking to business owners on the phone?



Q4 — What would cause you to miss a scheduled shift or stop showing up?



Q5 — Are you looking for short-term work or a long-term performance-based role?



Q6— When a lead is unqualified but insists on booking, what do you do?



No role-play calls required.



Screening is written only. First calls are paid.

title: APPOINTMENT SETTER — PERFORMANCE ROLE (NO SALES)
description:
APPOINTMENT SETTER — PERFORMANCE ROLE (NO SALES)



This is not a general VA role.

This is a pure appointment-setting position inside a high-volume sales system.



If you cannot hit daily numbers without excuses, do not apply.



?



???? ROLE SUMMARY (READ CAREFULLY)



You will:

 • Call and follow up with warm + cold leads

 • Make 150 outbound calls per day (minimum)

 • Qualify prospects using a fixed script

 • Book qualified appointments onto a calendar

 • Update Google Sheets with zero errors



You will NOT:

 • Close sales

 • Handle payments

 • Answer customer support questions

 • Modify scripts or freelance messaging

 • Skip call volume



This role is numbers-based only.



?



???? PERFORMANCE METRICS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)



You are evaluated on:

 • Appointments TAKEN (not just booked)

 • Show-up rate

 • Sheet accuracy

 • Daily call volume (150/day)



To remain active:

 • 150 calls/day

 • Minimum 6–8 qualified appointments/day

 • No missed shifts

 • No skipped reporting



High performers are placed into pods and scaled.

Low performers are removed quickly.



?



???? TRIAL PROCESS (WRITTEN ONLY)



There are no live role-play calls.



Trial includes:

 1. Short written qualification

 2. 3 written role-play responses (text only)

 3. If approved ? paid starter batch

 4. Performance on that batch determines long-term placement



First calls are paid.



?



?? IMPORTANT FIT WARNING



This role requires:

 • Comfort speaking with business owners

 • Following scripts exactly

 • Repetition

 • Rejection

 • High call volume daily



If you:

 • Get nervous on calls

 • Need motivation

 • Dislike structure

 • Prefer flexibility



???? Do not apply.



?



???? QUALIFICATION QUESTIONS (ANSWER ALL)



Q1 — Have you set appointments before?

What type of offers? How many calls per day? How many appointments/day?



Q2 — Can you follow a script exactly without improvising?

Yes or No (explain briefly).



Q3 — On a scale of 1–10, how comfortable are you speaking to business owners on the phone?

(Anything under 8 = not a fit.)



Q4 — What would cause you to miss a scheduled shift or stop showing up?

Be honest. Vague answers are auto-rejected.



Q5 — Are you looking for short-term work or a long-term performance-based role?

Explain.



Q6 — If a lead is unqualified but insists on booking, what do you do?

(There is a correct answer.)



?



???? FINAL NOTE



This role exists to support a January revenue sprint.



We are building fast, scaling hard, and removing friction.



Only apply if:

 • You can hit 150 calls/day

 • You can book 6–8 qualified appointments/day

 • You can show up every scheduled shift

 • You want to earn your seat through performance



Quality over excuses. Output over opinions.

title: Appointment Setter & Ops Coordinator (Part Time, MST Hours)
description:
Title: Appointment Setter & Onboarding Coordinator (Part-Time, Remote)



Who we are:

We run a performance-focused home remodeling marketing operation. High-ticket projects, fast lead flow, zero fluff. We care about speed, clean comms, and booked shows.



The role:

You will own two critical parts of our operation. First, speed-to-lead. Your primary job is to call new leads in under five minutes, book qualified appointments, run confirmations and reschedules, and keep perfect notes inside our CRM (GoHighLevel). Second, you will act as our Onboarding Coordinator, guiding new clients through the setup process by managing communication and collecting necessary assets. This is not a technical role — our back-end team handles all deep GHL builds. Your focus is on speed, communication, and organization.



What you’ll do:



•Call and text every new lead within five minutes during assigned hours.



•Run a first-hour follow-up cadence and keep touching until a clear yes/no.



•Book qualified leads to the calendar, send confirmation messages immediately, and manage reschedules fast.



•Execute a confirmation routine to protect show rate.



•Maintain clean, searchable notes with outcome, next step, and due time.



•Operate basic CRM settings: place calls, send SMS, move stages, trigger templates, and update contact fields.



•Act as the main point of contact for new clients during onboarding, guiding them through asset collection (e.g., logos, account access) and scheduling their kickoff call.



•End of day: send a short numbers report with attempts, bookings, shows/no-shows, and blockers.



What you’ve ideally done in the past:



•Proven setter or SDR experience handling inbound leads and calendar bookings.



•Consistent speed-to-lead under five minutes during your last role.



•Strong phone presence, clear English, confident pace, and concise objection handling.



•Hands-on with a dialer/CRM (GHL or similar) for daily calling and SMS.



•Track record of maintaining or improving show rates via confirmations and reschedules.



Hours, Pay, and Growth:



•Pay: Starts at $500 USD/month.



•Hours: Part-time, 9am–1pm Mountain Time (20 hours/week) coverage required.



•Growth Path: This role is planned to become full-time (40 hours/week) on April 27th, with a corresponding increase in base pay. This is a long-term position with a clear path for promotion into a Client Success or Operations Management role as the company scales. Performance bonuses will be implemented after a 6-month probation period.



How to apply:

Send one
 with the subject line: “Setter/Ops – I hit five minutes” and include:



1.A 2-minute Loom introducing yourself, your hours, and your last role’s KPIs.



2.Two raw call recordings to fresh inbound leads where you set an appointment.



3.A short Loom screen share in any dialer/CRM showing you place a call, send an SMS, move a stage, log a note properly, and send a booking confirmation.



4.A sample daily report you’ve actually used.



Only applicants who follow these steps will be considered. If you’re reliable, fast, and love turning leads into shows, we want to hear from you!

title: Telesales Agent — Retail & Liquor (Long-Term Contract)
description:

About the Role



We’re looking for a confident, driven Telesales Agent to support our growing retail and liquor programs across Australia.



This is a casual, part-time contract role designed to scale up or down depending on campaign requirements. You’ll be engaging directly with Australian retailers, supporting sell-in activity, driving ranging opportunities, and helping brands grow within independent retail channels.

title: Wholesale Coordinator
description:
Location: Remote 

Reports To: Wholesale Directors

Department: Wholesale



About Chamelo

Chamelo is a celebrity-backed brand growing triple digits. We bootstrapped our way to 8-figures and are about to close a VC round with the goal to accelerate growth toward an IPO.

At Chamelo, we’re engineering a new era of smart eyewear by combining state-of-the-art technology with cutting-edge style. Our mission goes beyond creating dynamic and stylish glasses—we’re pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in a traditionally static industry.

Our eyewear isn’t just functional—it’s bold, customizable, and effortlessly cool. Backed by iconic figures like Shaquille O’Neal and Bad Bunny, Chamelo is on pace for rapid expansion, offering an exciting opportunity to be part of our growth story.



About the Role

We are hiring two highly organized and detail-driven Wholesale Coordinators to support the rapid expansion of Chamelo’s global B2B and retail partnerships.

This role is critical in managing the end-to-end wholesale order lifecycle — from account onboarding and order processing to fulfillment coordination, inventory allocation, and post-delivery support. You will serve as the operational backbone of the wholesale team, ensuring a seamless experience for retail partners while maintaining internal accuracy and efficiency.

The ideal candidates are proactive, data-driven, and thrive in a fast-paced environment where precision, communication, and follow-through are essential.



Key Responsibilities

Wholesale Order Management

Process and manage wholesale purchase orders from receipt to fulfillment.

Validate pricing, SKUs, quantities, payment terms, and shipping requirements.

Coordinate order entry, acknowledgments, and invoice accuracy.

Track order status and provide timely updates to wholesale partners and internal teams.

Account & Partner Support

Assist with onboarding new wholesale accounts, including documentation and system setup.

Serve as a primary point of contact for order-related inquiries and operational requests.

Maintain strong, professional communication with retail buyers and distributors.

Support key accounts to ensure smooth reorders and ongoing partnership growth.

Inventory Allocation & Fulfillment Coordination

Work closely with supply chain and warehouse/3PL partners to allocate inventory for wholesale orders.

Monitor stock availability and communicate potential shortages or delays proactively.

Coordinate shipment scheduling and routing based on partner requirements and delivery windows.

Ensure compliance with retailer routing guides and packaging standards.

Data Management & Reporting

Maintain accurate wholesale data across ERP/CRM/order management systems.

Track wholesale KPIs such as order accuracy, fulfillment timelines, sell-through support, and backorder rates.

Assist in preparing weekly and monthly wholesale performance reports.

Help maintain up-to-date account records, price lists, and line sheets.

Cross-Team Collaboration

Partner with Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, and Customer Experience to ensure seamless execution.

Support product launches, seasonal buys, and promotional campaigns from an operational perspective.

Assist with trade shows, market appointments, and sample coordination as needed.

Contribute to building and improving scalable wholesale SOPs and workflows.



Qualifications

Strong organizational and time management skills with exceptional attention to detail.

Experience in wholesale, B2B sales support, order management, or supply chain coordination, preferably in ecommerce or consumer goods.

Proficiency with ERP/CRM systems, inventory tools, and Google Workspace/Microsoft Office.

Ability to manage multiple accounts and orders simultaneously in a deadline-driven environment.

Clear and professional written and verbal communication.

Solution-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Experience working with global retail partners, distributors, or 3PLs is a strong advantage.



What We Offer

Competitive above-market salary.

Paid time off and paid holidays.

13th month pay.

Regular performance bonus.

Annual salary bonus/increases based on performance.

Remote-friendly work environment.

Fun and collaborative culture with team contests.



Application Process

Please send your resume and answers to the following questions to 

Subject Line: “Wholesale Operator!”

Application Questions

If you could be one famous entrepreneur (alive or dead), who would you be and why?

One paragraph (5 sentences max) on any relevant experience you have.

Your favorite productivity hack.

What are your key strengths?

What are your weaknesses?

Your desired number of weekly hours & desired start date.

Your availability next week for a quick chat.

Equal Opportunity

Chamelo is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: FUNNEL BUILDER (Part-time)
description:
We’re hiring a Funnel Builder who knows how to architect, build, and optimize conversion-focused funnels using GoHighLevel and automation tools like 
 and Zapier.



This role is for someone who thinks in systems, understands how cold traffic behaves, and builds funnels cleanly and correctly. You are here to design, deploy, and improve funnels.  Your priorities are CRO, reliable automation, and creating a magical client experience from the first time someone interacts with our brand.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Team Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important, and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just managing marketing campaigns for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you think like a funnel and conversion architect? Do you enjoy structuring systems, workflows, and sales psychology that drives measurable results? Are you obsessed with improving KPIs by designing experiments and running tests? Do you take pride in building things properly the first time while still iterating and optimizing?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Funnel Architecture, Buildout & Optimization

- Build complete funnels inside GoHighLevel focused on lead generation

- Structure landing pages with conversion principles in mind

- Create and customize pages, forms, and
s

- Embed forms, manage page layouts, and ensure clean user flow across multiple devices

- Maintain proper tagging architecture and funnel logic



Automations, Workflows & Integrations

- Build and maintain workflows, automations, and multi-step sequences

- Implement conditional logic and clean tag-based systems

- Create 
 automations as needed

- Integrate APIs and third-party tools where required (OPTIONAL, but preferred)

- Set up UTM parameters, tracking codes, and verify traffic source links are set up correctly



Tracking, Optimization & Testing

- Implement Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager (bonus)

- Ensure accurate tracking and data flow across funnels

- Apply an A/B testing mindset to improve conversion rates

- Optimize funnels over time based on performance data and KPIs



Campaign Systems & Deployment

- Maintain clean, scalable campaign structures

- Collaborate with leadership on funnel improvements and testing plans

- Continuously learn and stay up to date on best practices to help brainstorm and make recommendations for improvements to our funnel ecosystem



Requirements:

- STRONG hands-on experience with GoHighLevel, required

- Recent experience with workflows, automations, tags, and sequences, required

- Experience building lead generation funnels (not ecom or dropshipping focused), required

- Experience with 
 and/or Zapier automations, required

- Understanding of conversion rate optimization and buyer behavior, required

- Ability to think in systems and campaign logic, required

- Clean build habits, required

- Moderate familiarity with cold traffic funnels, required

- Strong English communication skills; near-native preferred if involved in testing copy

- Interest in copy, funnel strategy, and optimization (execution-focused)

- A stable, high-speed internet connection, required (at least 150mbps)

- Growth mindset, required



BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)

- Meta Ads, Google Ads, or media buying familiarity

- Meta Pixel, GA4, GTM setup experience

- Basic SEO understanding

- API integrations beyond native tools



NOTE: This is a part-time role (5–15 hrs/week) with the opportunity to grow into a full-time position for the right person.



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.



As part of your application, include a Loom or YouTube video (2 minutes or less) explaining why you believe you’re a strong fit for this specific Funnel Builder role.







STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to an interview.



STEP 3:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 4:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Funnel Builder with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: AI Motion Designer. Short Form SaaS and B2B. Rebuild and Finish Required
description:
AI Motion Designer. Short Form SaaS and B2B. Rebuild and Finish Required



Pay

11 to 16 USD per hour. Set based on portfolio and trial output.

Rate reviews after the trial!



Trial

2 weeks. 10 hours per week. Paid.



Long-term

If you pass the trial and stay consistent. 20+ hours per week.



Location and time zone

We are based in New Zealand.

Async first. Weekdays.

One call per week max during NZ business hours.



MoveUp Studio

We make complex B2B clear. SaaS and B2B only. Clean work. High bar.



The job

You run production for our short form motion output.

You take rough bullets and turn them into 3 hook options.

We choose one. Then you build the post end to end.



Great type. Tight pacing. Clean composition. No noise. Every frame intentional.



You work across short form and long form.

Long form is support, not lead. Scene builds, cutdowns, and clean motion within our system.



Style bar

Minimal layouts. Strong type. Restrained motion.

Calm design. Clear hierarchy.



Story

Strong hook. Clean structure. No fluff.

You know what to show. What to cut.

You can simplify messy inputs without losing meaning.



What shipping looks like

After the trial, we aim for 3 to 5 MoveUp posts per week, depending on complexity.

Some weeks are 3 heavier pieces. Some are 5 lighter pieces.

We agree the target each Monday.



Typical post is 15 to 45 seconds.

Delivered with working files.

You build reusable type, layout, and transition components so output speeds up over time.



Client work

Client work comes first when scheduled.

If you perform, you get more hours and more variety.



Tools

After Effects and Illustrator required.

Clean, organized working files. No missing sources.



AI rules

AI is a core part of the workflow. We want someone genuinely strong with AI image and video tools. Fast and reliable.

Nothing raw ships. If you start with AI, you rebuild and finish it clean in Adobe.



AI video gen can be used as background plates only.

Anything that needs to be editable must be rebuilt into layered or vector assets and animated in After Effects.



If AI is used, you send

Source file or project link

Settings and prompts used

Rebuilt layered or vector files

Final After Effects project



Bonus

Basic short form editing and captions when needed.



Boundaries

No third party brands, UIs, faces, or unlicensed footage unless we approve it first.

If you are unsure about rights. Do not use it. Ask first.



Work standards

Clean files. Strict naming. Clean versioning.

Naming rule. Client. PostName. v01. YYYYMMDD.



Work log and pay

Hourly. Paid fortnightly.

Each work block includes start time, end time, what shipped, a preview link, and the working files link.



How we work

Async first. Low meetings. Clear feedback.

Quick daily update with a preview link when there is progress.

Most posts are one to two rounds. Extra rounds only if scope changes or we agree first.



Trial pass conditions

Two short form pieces shipped end to end.

At least one includes an AI rebuild.

Files must be complete. No missing sources.



Not a fit

Work feels generic

Weak AI rebuild workflow

Cannot provide sources, prompts, or rebuild files

Misses deadlines

Messy files or missing sources

Time logs do not match outputs

Needs constant direction

Style drifts into noise



Apply

Short note. Why this role.

Portfolio or reel.

Two short form examples.

One AI rebuild example.

One recent short form piece made from rough bullets. Include the bullets you started with.

If you do not have an AI rebuild example. Do not apply.



Next step for shortlisted applicants

60 second screen recording showing the AI source, your rebuild into layered or vector files, and the final motion piece.

title: Senior GoHighLevel Architect (Tattoo Studios & Events Group)
description:
Remote | Full-Time Project (Potential Ongoing Role)



Who We Are

We operate a fast-growing U.S.-based group of companies in the tattoo industry, including:

Multi-location tattoo studios

A large tattoo convention brand

An aftercare product company



We run paid ads across Meta & Google, generate thousands of leads per month, and are aggressively scaling into new locations.



We are now building a centralized GoHighLevel infrastructure to become the backbone of our entire organization.



This is not a small project. We want someone who can architect and build this correctly from day one.



The Mission

Build and fully optimize our GoHighLevel system across:

 Tattoo Studio Locations (first phase)

 Convention Brand (second phase)

 Artist Recruitment Funnel (third phase)

 Aftercare Brand (fourth phase)

We will be using the Unlimited subaccount version, with each location and company siloed properly.

This will include full CRM architecture, automation, reporting, SMS/email systems, call tracking, and ad integration.



Scope of Work



CRM & Subaccount Architecture:

Structure multiple subaccounts correctly

Build pipelines for each studio location

Create proper tagging systems

Set up user permissions for location staff

Design scalable infrastructure for future locations



Lead Capture & Automation:

Website form integration

Meta Ads integration

Google Ads integration

Call tracking + missed-call text back

Walk-in tagging system

Automated follow-up sequences

Rebooking automations

Review request systems

Nurture campaigns

SMS &
 workflows



Funnels & Campaigns:

Tattoo booking funnel

Artist recruitment funnel

Convention vendor funnel

Newsletter system (may replace Mailchimp)



Reporting & Dashboards:

Cost per lead

Lead-to-book rate

Show rate

Revenue tracking per location

Performance dashboards for leadership



System Setup:

Phone numbers within GHL

Reputation management

Calendar setup

Proper automation testing

Documentation of system architecture





What We’re Looking For

You are not just a “GHL user.”

You are a systems thinker.



You:

Have built multi-location GHL setups before

Understand attribution and reporting deeply

Know how to reduce lead leakage

Think in terms of conversion rates

Build scalable automation systems

Know SMS compliance rules

Can confidently integrate Meta & Google Ads



You should be able to:

Audit an existing account

Propose improvements

Architect from scratch

Build clean workflows

Document everything clearly



What Success Looks Like (90 Days):

Every location has a clean pipeline

No leads go unfollowed

Missed calls trigger auto-text

Rebooking reminders active

Review requests automated

Marketing dashboard live

Leadership can see performance metrics weekly

System built to scale for new locations easily



Growth Opportunity

This starts as a project role.

If executed well, this may become:

Ongoing GHL system manager

Automation lead

Long-term strategic operations role



We are expanding into additional locations and brands.

There will be no shortage of systems to build.



To Apply Send:



A message explaining:

A multi-location GHL setup you built

How you structure pipelines

How you prevent lead leakage



A short written answer:

What are the 3 biggest mistakes businesses make when setting up GoHighLevel?

Your availability.



Important

We are not looking for:

Someone learning GHL

Someone who needs step-by-step instructions

Someone who builds messy automations



We want someone who can own this system.



If you are a serious GoHighLevel architect and want to build something large and scalable, we want to talk.

title: Trading Chart Research & Sync Editor (Content VA) – Remote
description:
Hello — hope you’re doing well!

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



This is a long-term collaborative opportunity for editors who value consistency, creativity, and growth alongside a dedicated team.

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



We run a high-quality trading education channel and are looking for a resourceful, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant who can listen to a narrated voiceover, understand the trading concepts being explained, and find (or recreate) charts that perfectly match each segment.



This position blends chart literacy with creative problem-solving — you’ll often need to recognize what’s being discussed even when the term isn’t explicitly stated, and then source or recreate the right chart to visually communicate the concept to viewers.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Responsibilities

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Listen closely to the provided clip and tell the story through accurate, well-timed chart visuals.



Understand the trading term, setup, or market condition being discussed.



Locate, screenshot, or recreate high-quality trading charts that match the narration.



Add relevant effects, transitions, and annotations using Camtasia to enhance storytelling and maintain viewer engagement.



Verify each chart shows the correct instrument, timeframe, and clarity.



Organize and deliver charts in sequence for the video editor to sync.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Requirements

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Strong understanding of core trading concepts (support/resistance, indicators, market structure, patterns, liquidity grabs, etc.).



Ability to deduce and identify setups even when implied in narration.



Hands-on experience with TradingView or similar charting platforms.



Resourceful and precise — able to find the best visual representation, not just the easiest one.



Exceptional attention to detail, timing, and visual storytelling.





________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Platform Requirement

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Camtasia is required for the entire project.



You will be provided with all effects, transitions, and other tools needed to complete the work through our Camtasia Library package.



All work must be created, edited, and exported through Camtasia, ensuring all effects, transitions, and assets are properly embedded in the Camtasia Library Package (.libzip) format.



You may use the free version — a paid license is not required.



Ensure your system can run Camtasia smoothly and handle exporting without lag or crashes.





________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Training & Brand Style

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Full training provided on our chart color codes, formatting, and visual standards.



Access to visual templates to ensure consistency across all videos.



The goal: maintain a clean, professional, and uniform chart style that aligns with our brand identity.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Nice to Have

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Previous experience in trading or finance-related content creation.



Familiarity with educational or YouTube-based video production workflows.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Workload & Pay

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



1 video per month (8–12 minutes each)



(Includes a 1-minute clip workflow to maintain consistency and quality across projects.)



Pay Range: $70 – $150+ per video



Based on:



- Skill level



- Creativity



- Accuracy



- Execution quality



- Turnaround time



- Effort level



The link below showcases the work produced by editors on the team. All of the edits are strong, but each one reflects a different level of dedication, detail, and overall quality — and that’s exactly why we use an incentive-based system. 



The harder you work, and the more accurately and creatively you execute the story using chart visuals and our effects library, the more you earn.







________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Flexible schedule — because we view editors as partners, you’re trusted to manage your own time, work efficiently, and find the pace that suits you best while still delivering within a reasonable timeframe.



________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



How to Apply

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 



Include the word “RSI” at the top of your application to confirm you’ve read this description.

In your message, please share:



Your experience with trading and charting platforms.



Any examples or samples of your past trading visuals or chart work.



If you have any questions at all , don’t hesitate to ask — we value clear communication and collaboration. 



Thank you for your time.

title: Skilled Social Media video editor for coach
description:
Video Editor for Personal Brand Coaching Content

(Clean, Premium, Story-Driven Style)



++++Please read the whole description carefully++++



After reading this, please only message me with:



• Your edited trial reel useing this footage 
/file/d/12IhNBjYG7cIo01jWAWhLo_D9MycJMUTO/view?usp=sharing

• A short note about you and why you’d be a strong fit

• Your monthly rate



Keep it concise and intentional.



I’m a mindset and performance coach creating short-form video content for Instagram (Reels), TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.



I’m looking for a long-term editor who understands clean, subtle editing and knows how to support the message rather than overpower it.





What I Need



• 20 to 30 short-form videos per month

• 30 to 60 seconds each

• Strong hooks in the first 1–2 seconds

• Retention-focused pacing

• Organized workflow

• Fast turnaround



What I Will Provide



• Raw talking-head footage

• Occasional B-roll folders (walking shots, podcast clips, etc.)

• Clear direction on hook and message



Editing Style I Want



• Clean and minimal

• Premium feel

• Music that supports pacing but never overpowers the voice

• Subtle zoom cuts to maintain energy

• Simple captions (white or neutral tones, no bright colors)

• Strong visual rhythm

• Thoughtful storytelling through the edit



The edit should enhance clarity and emotional impact, not distract from the message.



What I Do NOT Want



• Overly trendy TikTok-style edits

• Excessive motion graphics

• 
-style inserts

• Distracting subtitles

• Heavy visual effects

• Random stock footage that feels generic

• “Over-edited” AI-looking visuals



This is premium coaching content. It should feel confident, sharp, and intentional.



Trial Edit Requirement



To ensure this is a strong fit, I’ve attached a sample clip.



You do not need to edit the full video.

Please send back a 15–30 second cut that demonstrates:



• A strong hook

• Clean pacing

• Premium storytelling

• How you incorporate Oprah Winfrey (photo or video) over my footage

• Your caption style

• Your overall editing approach



I’m looking for editors who not only execute well, but also bring ideas.

If you have creative instincts around structure, rhythm, or format development, that’s a plus. I want someone who wants to grow as the brand grows.



Compensation



Please include your monthly rate for 20–30 videos when submitting your trial reel.



I’m looking for someone long-term who wants to build something recognizable and evolve the content over time.

title: Visual Marketing Designer (Funnels + Graphics)
description:
Virtualee & Co is an online business management agency that empowers stuck and overwhelmed Coaches & Founders to scale their business & reclaim their time. And our all-female wonders team is looking for you!



We’re looking for a Visual Marketing Designer (Funnels + Graphics) who thrives on details, creativity, strategy, and results. You’ll be responsible for designing high-converting marketing funnels and crafting visuals that are both stunning and strategic. If you're a visual storyteller who’s obsessed with user experience and knows how to turn ideas into eye-catching designs that drive action—we want to meet you.



Key Responsibilities:



Funnel Design Mastery: Strategize, design and optimize end-to-end marketing funnels, ensuring a seamless and visually appealing user journey. Collaborating with the team to align funnel designs with campaign objectives.



Visual Storytelling: Create captivating graphics, illustrations, and visual elements to tell compelling brand and product or service stories. Develop a cohesive visual identity that resonates with our target audience.



Creative Precision: Bring strong attention to detail, a keen sense of aesthetics, and creative thinking to every project from layout to final approvals.



Conversion Optimization: Brainstorm, suggest, and implement design strategies to enhance conversion rates at every stage of the funnel. Must also be able to monitor results and bring light to highest performing variables for optimization.



Responsive Design: Ensure all funnel elements are optimized for various devices, providing a seamless experience across desktop, tablet, and mobile.



Collaboration and Iteration: Embrace feedback and iterate on designs to continuously improve performance.



Stay Ahead of Design Trends: Keep a pulse on the latest design trends, techniques, and tools in the digital marketing space, including social media. Implement innovative and fresh design elements to stay ahead of the competition. Continuously expand your knowledge of sales funnel design and digital marketing strategies.



Qualifications:



Proven experience in strategizing and designing marketing funnels with a focus on conversion optimization.

Proficiency in graphic design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Canva).

Strong understanding of user experience (UX) principles and responsive design.

Proficiency in funnel-building or website platforms (e.g., ClickFunnels, Kajabi, WordPress, Leadpages) is a strong plus.

A creative thinker with strong attention to detail and a keen sense of aesthetics



Preferred Skills:



Familiarity with marketing automation platforms and CRM systems.

Ability to translate complex concepts into visually appealing and easy-to-understand graphics.

Strong project management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.



Please send us your most updated CV and portfolio when you apply.

s, calendars, and appointments

mbers and clients

 marketing workflows using tools such as Kit, HubSpot, Kajabi, etc.

etings and client meetings as scheduled

mbers as needed to meet deadlines

Research & Technical Assistance

Support virtual meetings and online collaboration

Tools & Platforms You Should Be Comfortable With

Qualifications

Direct experience working with online coaches

Strong organizational and multitasking skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work independently, reliably, and take initiative

Strong attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent time management skills

High level of accountability and ownership

Discretion and confidentiality with sensitive information

Comfortable learning and adapting to new tools and systems

Experience with tool integrations (CRMs, forms, schedulers, websites)

Committed to personal and professional growth



This Role Is For You If:

You understand how coaching businesses and launches actually work

You thrive in structured systems but adapt easily when priorities shift

You don’t need to be micromanaged

You catch issues before they become problems

You enjoy making things run smoothly behind the scenes

You value clear communication, teamwork, and follow-through



What Success Looks Like



Task Execution & Efficiency

Launch timelines are followed and backend setup runs smoothly

Inbox and calendar management reduce friction and confusion

Proactive communication minimizes manual follow-ups



Initiative & Problem-Solving

Team & Client Experience

Clients experience smooth launches and clear communication

Tea
mbers find delegation and systems easy to navigate

You contribute ideas that improve workflows and execution



Team Culture

We value growth, clarity, and connection.

From sharing book recommendations to cheering each other on in fitness goals, we believe great work happens in an environment that feels human. We love good coffee, meaningful conversations, and building systems that support real lives — not burnout.



If you love supporting coaches, bringing launches to life behind the scenes, and being part of a collaborative, high-standards team, we’d love to meet you.

title: Job Opportunity: Long-Term Employment with Growing Insurance Supplement Company
description:
Are you looking for a stable, long-term position where attention to detail and expertise are highly valued? We are seeking a dedicated individual with experience in Xactimate and a solid understanding of roofing components.

About Us: We are an insurance supplement company that partners with roofing contractors to assist in supplementing their insurance jobs. Our work involves reviewing photos of roofs, analyzing the original estimates, and creating detailed supplements that include necessary additions for rebuilding, supported by citing code and providing photo justification.



Key Responsibilities:

• Analyze roofing photos and original estimates to identify missing or required line items.

• Create detailed and accurate supplements using Xactimate.

• Communicate primarily via
 with insurance companies, and occasionally speak directly with adjusters to justify the inclusion of certain line items.

• Maintain a high level of detail and accuracy in all communications and reports.



Requirements:

• Proficiency in Xactimate and an understanding of roofing components.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to work night shifts (9 AM - 5 PM ET).

• A keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.

• Willingness to adapt and grow with a rapidly expanding company.



What We Offer:

• A chance to be part of a small but fast-growing company with significant opportunities for advancement.

• A supportive work environment that values hard work, dedication, and continuous improvement.

• A role that will challenge you, with the potential for professional growth and career development.





We are looking to hire 3-4 estimators in December. 



If you’re up for the challenge and ready to contribute to our team's success, we encourage you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who is looking to grow with us and make a meaningful impact in the insurance supplement industry.

title: SEO Content Writer & Blog Publisher (Manual Writing, AI-Assisted)
description:
I’m looking for a long-term SEO blog writer to manage weekly or bi-weekly blog posts across 5 websites. This is steady work.



Important: Blogs cannot be fully AI-written. AI tools can be used to assist with outlining or research, but the final article must be primarily human-written. All posts will be run through multiple AI detection tools before publishing.



If you rely entirely on AI to generate content, this role is not a fit.



What You’ll Do

– Write weekly or bi-weekly SEO blog posts

– Research and suggest original topics (no duplicates)

– Naturally include provided keywords

– Use tools like AnswerThePublic for topic inspiration

– Generate blog images using Freepik descriptions and AI image tools

– Log into WordPress and manually publish posts

– Properly format content (H1, H2, spacing, internal links, images, meta description, etc.)

– Follow on-page SEO best practices

title: Marketing Executive
description:
JOB TYPE: Full-Time



JOB SUMMARY:

We are seeking a client-focused Marketing Executive with strong expertise in AI-based marketing tools and CRM platforms to support lead generation, client communication, and campaign execution for the US market. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working directly with clients, generating qualified leads, preparing presentations, making cold calls and managing professional

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

 campaigns and follow-up communications with prospects and clients.

REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

Strong experience in writing professional
s and follow-up messages aligned with US business communication standards.

PREFERRED SKILLS:

title: Senior Meta Ads Media Buyer – $600K/Month Spend – Performance Only
description:
We are currently spending $600,000 per month on Meta Ads and scaling aggressively.

We are not a beginner brand. We are not testing with $50/day budgets.



We move fast. We test fast. We scale fast.



If you are looking for a “stable 9–5 marketing role” or a company that moves slowly and cautiously — this is not for you.



Read This Carefully Before Applying



We do not care about:

- Whether the product is white, grey, or black

- Whether it’s “ethical enough” for your personal beliefs



We care about one thing:



- Performance. ROI. Scale.

- If you are strongly opinion-driven about product categories or morality in advertising, do not apply.

- If you are driven by numbers, performance, and growth — keep reading.



What We Need



A killer Meta Ads media buyer who:

- Has managed $100K+/month budgets minimum (proof required)

- Understands scaling structures (CBO, ABO, ASC, cost caps, bid caps)

- Knows how to scale aggressively without crashing accounts

- Understands creatives testing at scale

- Thinks in data, not emotions

- Can operate independently without hand-holding

- You must be comfortable working in high-risk, high-speed environments.



What You’ll Be Responsible For:

You are not just managing campaigns.

You are building and running the performance department.

You will build and lead:

1 Junior Media Buyer

1 Creative Strategist

1 Data / Reporting Assistant



Strategic Ownership:

- Full responsibility for Meta performance at ~$600K/month spend

- Designing and evolving the scaling structure

- Protecting MER and blended profitability

- Managing performance during aggressive growth phases



You own results.



Team Leadership & Development:

Directly manage the Junior Media Buyer

Direct creative direction through the Creative Strategist

Oversee reporting accuracy via the Data Assistant

Create SOPs and workflows

Improve team efficiency



As we scale, you will:



Identify gaps in the team

Define new roles when needed

Participate in hiring decisions

Help build a high-performance performance department



You are expected to think like a Head of Performance, not just a buyer.



No babysitting.

No “let’s wait 7 days for learning phase.”

No excuses.



DO NOT APPLY:

Beginners

Agency account managers 

Ethical purists uncomfortable with aggressive scaling

People who need constant direction

People who blame the algorithm for everything



Compensation:

We pay well for killers.

Base salary (depending on experience)

Performance bonus tied to scale & profitability

Long-term opportunity for serious operators

If you make us money, you will make a lot of money.



Reporting & Communication:



Daily and weekly executive-level performance summary

Clear action plans

No vanity metrics

No excuses



Application Instructions (IMPORTANT)

To avoid wasting time, follow these steps exactly. Applications that do not follow instructions will be ignored.



Start your application with:

“I manage at least $100K/month.”

Attach screenshots clearly showing:

- Monthly spend

- ROAS

- Revenue generated



Briefly explain:

- Your biggest scaling win

-Your biggest failure and what you learned



Confirm clearly that you are comfortable working with any product category.



Record a 2–3 minute video introduction (REQUIRED).

No edited agency showreels. Just you speaking directly.

We want to see clarity, confidence, and competence.

title: Long-term Implementor Opportunity | Custom Shopify Store Development

- Joining meetings anywhere from 9am to 5pm EST to communicate about vision and needs on a weekly basis.

- Reporting directly to our marketing director.

- Bug-free and thoroughly tested features.

- Documentation for all changes made.



Prerequisites:

- Available from 9am to 5pm, Monday to Friday.

- Proficient in English.

- Proficient in CRO technology (
, GA4)

- Slack and
 reachability.

- Follows instructions to the tea.

- From stage 2 onwards, you will become full-time. Work other than Arc Grove is prohibited.

- Performance (site-load) considerations.

- Scalability notes for future.



How things will work:

1. Meeting to go over expectations of deliverable and timeline.

2. implementation of what's needed.

3. Communication of what is done during business hours.

4. Meeting to go over what is done and pushing live.



Stages:



Stage 1: Current Project Scope - 2 week prohibitionary period

Hours: 80 hours, 40 hours a week, 9am-5pm est availability.

Hourly wage: $7/hr

Delivery time: 2 weeks from start.

Information: You will be provided a brief of what needs to be changed. Respond with considerations of how and what needs to be done, any gaps in knowledge that you need to know in order to implement. Before starting, documentation of current website will be provided to you.



Stage 2: Implementation Tea
mber

Hourly wage: $9/hr

Information: This stage of collaboration will look like the 2 week probationary period, just a bigger scope and more projects.



Stage 3: Conversion rate optimization + Implementation Tea
mber

Hourly wage: $12/hr

Start date: If experience in CRO is observed from marketing director, and when all changes in stage 2 are implemented/

Information: Implementation, design in Figma, website and client experience analysis.



Next steps if interested:

- Reply with your resume including your entire career history.

- Include "Horse Year" in your title.

- Reply with any supporting backend documents that supports evidence to your resume.

- Reply with questions if there is any.



You will then get a brief of what needs to be done if your expertise suffices. Steps after getting the brief is mentioned above.

Bonus Experience

 To Apply

mbers.

title: Wholesale Coordinator
description:
Location: Remote 

Reports To: Wholesale Directors

Department: Wholesale



About Chamelo

Chamelo is a celebrity-backed brand growing triple digits. We bootstrapped our way to 8-figures and are about to close a VC round with the goal to accelerate growth toward an IPO.

At Chamelo, we’re engineering a new era of smart eyewear by combining state-of-the-art technology with cutting-edge style. Our mission goes beyond creating dynamic and stylish glasses—we’re pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in a traditionally static industry.

Our eyewear isn’t just functional—it’s bold, customizable, and effortlessly cool. Backed by iconic figures like Shaquille O’Neal and Bad Bunny, Chamelo is on pace for rapid expansion, offering an exciting opportunity to be part of our growth story.



About the Role

We are hiring two highly organized and detail-driven Wholesale Coordinators to support the rapid expansion of Chamelo’s global B2B and retail partnerships.

This role is critical in managing the end-to-end wholesale order lifecycle — from account onboarding and order processing to fulfillment coordination, inventory allocation, and post-delivery support. You will serve as the operational backbone of the wholesale team, ensuring a seamless experience for retail partners while maintaining internal accuracy and efficiency.

The ideal candidates are proactive, data-driven, and thrive in a fast-paced environment where precision, communication, and follow-through are essential.



Key Responsibilities

Wholesale Order Management

Process and manage wholesale purchase orders from receipt to fulfillment.

Validate pricing, SKUs, quantities, payment terms, and shipping requirements.

Coordinate order entry, acknowledgments, and invoice accuracy.

Track order status and provide timely updates to wholesale partners and internal teams.

Account & Partner Support

Assist with onboarding new wholesale accounts, including documentation and system setup.

Serve as a primary point of contact for order-related inquiries and operational requests.

Maintain strong, professional communication with retail buyers and distributors.

Support key accounts to ensure smooth reorders and ongoing partnership growth.

Inventory Allocation & Fulfillment Coordination

Work closely with supply chain and warehouse/3PL partners to allocate inventory for wholesale orders.

Monitor stock availability and communicate potential shortages or delays proactively.

Coordinate shipment scheduling and routing based on partner requirements and delivery windows.

Ensure compliance with retailer routing guides and packaging standards.

Data Management & Reporting

Maintain accurate wholesale data across ERP/CRM/order management systems.

Track wholesale KPIs such as order accuracy, fulfillment timelines, sell-through support, and backorder rates.

Assist in preparing weekly and monthly wholesale performance reports.

Help maintain up-to-date account records, price lists, and line sheets.

Cross-Team Collaboration

Partner with Sales, Finance, Supply Chain, and Customer Experience to ensure seamless execution.

Support product launches, seasonal buys, and promotional campaigns from an operational perspective.

Assist with trade shows, market appointments, and sample coordination as needed.

Contribute to building and improving scalable wholesale SOPs and workflows.



Qualifications

Strong organizational and time management skills with exceptional attention to detail.

Experience in wholesale, B2B sales support, order management, or supply chain coordination, preferably in ecommerce or consumer goods.

Proficiency with ERP/CRM systems, inventory tools, and Google Workspace/Microsoft Office.

Ability to manage multiple accounts and orders simultaneously in a deadline-driven environment.

Clear and professional written and verbal communication.

Solution-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Experience working with global retail partners, distributors, or 3PLs is a strong advantage.



What We Offer

Competitive above-market salary.

Paid time off and paid holidays.

13th month pay.

Regular performance bonus.

Annual salary bonus/increases based on performance.

Remote-friendly work environment.

Fun and collaborative culture with team contests.



Application Process

Please send your resume and answers to the following questions to
